10/*
11 * Terminal window support, see ":help :terminal".
12 *
13 * There are three parts:
14 * 1. Generic code for all systems.
15 * Uses libvterm for the terminal emulator.
16 * 2. The MS-Windows implementation.
17 * Uses winpty.
18 * 3. The Unix-like implementation.
19 * Uses pseudo-tty's (pty's).
20 *
21 * For each terminal one VTerm is constructed. This uses libvterm. A copy of
22 * this library is in the libvterm directory.
23 *
24 * When a terminal window is opened, a job is started that will be connected to
25 * the terminal emulator.
26 *
27 * If the terminal window has keyboard focus, typed keys are converted to the
28 * terminal encoding and writing to the job over a channel.
29 *
30 * If the job produces output, it is written to the terminal emulator. The
31 * terminal emulator invokes callbacks when its screen content changes. The
32 * line range is stored in tl_dirty_row_start and tl_dirty_row_end. Once in a
33 * while, if the terminal window is visible, the screen contents is drawn.
34 *
35 * When the job ends the text is put in a buffer. Redrawing then happens from
36 * that buffer, attributes come from the scrollback buffer tl_scrollback.
37 * When the buffer is changed it is turned into a normal buffer, the attributes
38 * in tl_scrollback are no longer used.
39 */
40

224 static int
225cursor_color_equal(char_u *lhs_color, char_u *rhs_color)
226{
227 if (lhs_color != NULL((void*)0) && rhs_color != NULL((void*)0))
228 return STRCMP(lhs_color, rhs_color)strcmp((char *)(lhs_color), (char *)(rhs_color)) == 0;
229 return lhs_color == NULL((void*)0) && rhs_color == NULL((void*)0);
230}
231
232 static void
233cursor_color_copy(char_u **to_color, char_u *from_color)
234{
235 // Avoid a free & alloc if the value is already right.
236 if (cursor_color_equal(*to_color, from_color))
237 return;
238 vim_free(*to_color);
239 *to_color = (from_color == NULL((void*)0)) ? NULL((void*)0) : vim_strsave(from_color);
240}
241
242 static char_u *
243cursor_color_get(char_u *color)
244{
245 return (color == NULL((void*)0)) ? (char_u *)"" : color;
246}

249/*
250 * Parse 'termwinsize' and set "rows" and "cols" for the terminal size in the
251 * current window.
252 * Sets "rows" and/or "cols" to zero when it should follow the window size.
253 * Return TRUE if the size is the minimum size: "24*80".
254 */
255 static int
256parse_termwinsize(win_T *wp, int *rows, int *cols)
257{
258 int minsize = FALSE0;
259
260 *rows = 0;
261 *cols = 0;
262
263 if (*wp->w_p_twsw_onebuf_opt.wo_tws != NUL'\000')
264 {
265 char_u *p = vim_strchr(wp->w_p_twsw_onebuf_opt.wo_tws, 'x');
266
267 // Syntax of value was already checked when it's set.
268 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
269 {
270 minsize = TRUE1;
271 p = vim_strchr(wp->w_p_twsw_onebuf_opt.wo_tws, '*');
272 }
273 *rows = atoi((char *)wp->w_p_twsw_onebuf_opt.wo_tws);
274 *cols = atoi((char *)p + 1);
275 }
276 return minsize;
277}
278
279/*
280 * Determine the terminal size from 'termwinsize' and the current window.
281 */
282 static void
283set_term_and_win_size(term_T *term, jobopt_T *opt)
284{
285 int rows, cols;
286 int minsize;
287
288#ifdef FEAT_GUI
289 if (term->tl_system)
290 {
291 // Use the whole screen for the system command. However, it will start
292 // at the command line and scroll up as needed, using tl_toprow.
293 term->tl_rows = Rows;
294 term->tl_cols = Columns;
295 return;
296 }
297#endif
298 term->tl_rows = curwin->w_height;
299 term->tl_cols = curwin->w_width;
300
301 minsize = parse_termwinsize(curwin, &rows, &cols);
302 if (minsize)
303 {
304 if (term->tl_rows < rows)
305 term->tl_rows = rows;
306 if (term->tl_cols < cols)
307 term->tl_cols = cols;
308 }
309 if ((opt->jo_set2 & JO2_TERM_ROWS0x0040))
310 term->tl_rows = opt->jo_term_rows;
311 else if (rows != 0)
312 term->tl_rows = rows;
313 if ((opt->jo_set2 & JO2_TERM_COLS0x0080))
314 term->tl_cols = opt->jo_term_cols;
315 else if (cols != 0)
316 term->tl_cols = cols;
317
318 if (!opt->jo_hidden)
319 {
320 if (term->tl_rows != curwin->w_height)
321 win_setheight_win(term->tl_rows, curwin);
322 if (term->tl_cols != curwin->w_width)
323 win_setwidth_win(term->tl_cols, curwin);
324
325 // Set 'winsize' now to avoid a resize at the next redraw.
326 if (!minsize && *curwin->w_p_twsw_onebuf_opt.wo_tws != NUL'\000')
327 {
328 char_u buf[100];
329
330 vim_snprintf((char *)buf, 100, "%dx%d",
331 term->tl_rows, term->tl_cols);
332 set_option_value((char_u *)"termwinsize", 0L, buf, OPT_LOCAL0x04);
333 }
334 }
335}

337/*
338 * Initialize job options for a terminal job.
339 * Caller may overrule some of them.
340 */
341 void
342init_job_options(jobopt_T *opt)
343{
344 clear_job_options(opt);
345
346 opt->jo_mode = MODE_RAW;
347 opt->jo_out_mode = MODE_RAW;
348 opt->jo_err_mode = MODE_RAW;
349 opt->jo_set = JO_MODE0x0001 | JO_OUT_MODE0x0004 | JO_ERR_MODE0x0008;
350}
351
352/*
353 * Set job options mandatory for a terminal job.
354 */
355 static void
356setup_job_options(jobopt_T *opt, int rows, int cols)
357{
358#ifndef MSWIN
359 // Win32: Redirecting the job output won't work, thus always connect stdout
360 // here.
361 if (!(opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_IO0x10000))
362#endif
363 {
364 // Connect stdout to the terminal.
365 opt->jo_io[PART_OUT] = JIO_BUFFER;
366 opt->jo_io_buf[PART_OUT] = curbuf->b_fnum;
367 opt->jo_modifiable[PART_OUT] = 0;
368 opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_IO0x10000 + JO_OUT_BUF0x1000000 + JO_OUT_MODIFIABLE0x20000000;
369 }
370
371#ifndef MSWIN
372 // Win32: Redirecting the job output won't work, thus always connect stderr
373 // here.
374 if (!(opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_IO0x20000))
375#endif
376 {
377 // Connect stderr to the terminal.
378 opt->jo_io[PART_ERR] = JIO_BUFFER;
379 opt->jo_io_buf[PART_ERR] = curbuf->b_fnum;
380 opt->jo_modifiable[PART_ERR] = 0;
381 opt->jo_set |= JO_ERR_IO0x20000 + JO_ERR_BUF0x2000000 + JO_ERR_MODIFIABLE0x40000000;
382 }
383
384 opt->jo_pty = TRUE1;
385 if ((opt->jo_set2 & JO2_TERM_ROWS0x0040) == 0)
386 opt->jo_term_rows = rows;
387 if ((opt->jo_set2 & JO2_TERM_COLS0x0080) == 0)
388 opt->jo_term_cols = cols;
389}

401/*
402 * Close a terminal buffer (and its window). Used when creating the terminal
403 * fails.
404 */
405 static void
406term_close_buffer(buf_T *buf, buf_T *old_curbuf)
407{
408 free_terminal(buf);
409 if (old_curbuf != NULL((void*)0))
410 {
411 --curbuf->b_nwindows;
412 curbuf = old_curbuf;
413 curwin->w_buffer = curbuf;
414 ++curbuf->b_nwindows;
415 }
416 CHECK_CURBUF;
417
418 // Wiping out the buffer will also close the window and call
419 // free_terminal().
420 do_buffer(DOBUF_WIPE4, DOBUF_FIRST1, FORWARD1, buf->b_fnum, TRUE1);
421}

423/*
424 * Start a terminal window and return its buffer.
425 * Use either "argvar" or "argv", the other must be NULL.
426 * When "flags" has TERM_START_NOJOB only create the buffer, b_term and open
427 * the window.
428 * Returns NULL when failed.
429 */
430 buf_T *
431term_start(
432 typval_T *argvar,
433 char **argv,
434 jobopt_T *opt,
435 int flags)
436{
437 exarg_T split_ea;
438 win_T *old_curwin = curwin;
439 term_T *term;
440 buf_T *old_curbuf = NULL((void*)0);
441 int res;
442 buf_T *newbuf;
443 int vertical = opt->jo_vertical || (cmdmod.cmod_split & WSP_VERT2);
444 jobopt_T orig_opt; // only partly filled
445
446 if (check_restricted() || check_secure())
447 return NULL((void*)0);
448
449 if ((opt->jo_set & (JO_IN_IO0x40000 + JO_OUT_IO0x10000 + JO_ERR_IO0x20000))
450 == (JO_IN_IO0x40000 + JO_OUT_IO0x10000 + JO_ERR_IO0x20000)
451 || (!(opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_IO0x10000) && (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_BUF0x1000000))
452 || (!(opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_IO0x20000) && (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_BUF0x2000000))
453 || (argvar != NULL((void*)0)
454 && argvar->v_type == VAR_LIST
455 && argvar->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)
456 && argvar->vval.v_list->lv_first == &range_list_item))
457 {
458 emsg(_(e_invarg)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg), 5));
459 return NULL((void*)0);
460 }
461
462 term = ALLOC_CLEAR_ONE(term_T)(term_T *)alloc_clear(sizeof(term_T));
463 if (term == NULL((void*)0))
464 return NULL((void*)0);
465 term->tl_dirty_row_end = MAX_ROW999999;
466 term->tl_cursor_visible = TRUE1;
467 term->tl_cursor_shape = VTERM_PROP_CURSORSHAPE_BLOCK;
468 term->tl_finish = opt->jo_term_finish;
469#ifdef FEAT_GUI
470 term->tl_system = (flags & TERM_START_SYSTEM4);
471#endif
472 ga_init2(&term->tl_scrollback, sizeof(sb_line_T), 300);
473 ga_init2(&term->tl_scrollback_postponed, sizeof(sb_line_T), 300);
474 ga_init2(&term->tl_osc_buf, sizeof(char), 300);
475
476 CLEAR_FIELD(split_ea)memset((&(split_ea)), (0), (sizeof(split_ea)));
477 if (opt->jo_curwin)
478 {
479 // Create a new buffer in the current window.
480 if (!can_abandon(curbuf, flags & TERM_START_FORCEIT2))
481 {
482 no_write_message();
483 vim_free(term);
484 return NULL((void*)0);
485 }
486 if (do_ecmd(0, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), &split_ea, ECMD_ONE(linenr_T)1,
487 (buf_hide(curwin->w_buffer) ? ECMD_HIDE0x01 : 0)
488 + ((flags & TERM_START_FORCEIT2) ? ECMD_FORCEIT0x08 : 0),
489 curwin) == FAIL0)
490 {
491 vim_free(term);
492 return NULL((void*)0);
493 }
494 }
495 else if (opt->jo_hidden || (flags & TERM_START_SYSTEM4))
496 {
497 buf_T *buf;
498
499 // Create a new buffer without a window. Make it the current buffer for
500 // a moment to be able to do the initializations.
501 buf = buflist_new((char_u *)"", NULL((void*)0), (linenr_T)0,
502 BLN_NEW8 | BLN_LISTED2);
503 if (buf == NULL((void*)0) || ml_open(buf) == FAIL0)
504 {
505 vim_free(term);
506 return NULL((void*)0);
507 }
508 old_curbuf = curbuf;
509 --curbuf->b_nwindows;
510 curbuf = buf;
511 curwin->w_buffer = buf;
512 ++curbuf->b_nwindows;
513 }
514 else
515 {
516 // Open a new window or tab.
517 split_ea.cmdidx = CMD_new;
518 split_ea.cmd = (char_u *)"new";
519 split_ea.arg = (char_u *)"";
520 if (opt->jo_term_rows > 0 && !vertical)
521 {
522 split_ea.line2 = opt->jo_term_rows;
523 split_ea.addr_count = 1;
524 }
525 if (opt->jo_term_cols > 0 && vertical)
526 {
527 split_ea.line2 = opt->jo_term_cols;
528 split_ea.addr_count = 1;
529 }
530
531 if (vertical)
532 cmdmod.cmod_split |= WSP_VERT2;
533 ex_splitview(&split_ea);
534 if (curwin == old_curwin)
535 {
536 // split failed
537 vim_free(term);
538 return NULL((void*)0);
539 }
540 }
541 term->tl_buffer = curbuf;
542 curbuf->b_term = term;
543
544 if (!opt->jo_hidden)
545 {
546 // Only one size was taken care of with :new, do the other one. With
547 // "curwin" both need to be done.
548 if (opt->jo_term_rows > 0 && (opt->jo_curwin || vertical))
549 win_setheight(opt->jo_term_rows);
550 if (opt->jo_term_cols > 0 && (opt->jo_curwin || !vertical))
551 win_setwidth(opt->jo_term_cols);
552 }
553
554 // Link the new terminal in the list of active terminals.
555 term->tl_next = first_term;
556 first_term = term;
557
558 apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFFILEPRE, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
559
560 if (opt->jo_term_name != NULL((void*)0))
561 {
562 vim_free(curbuf->b_ffname);
563 curbuf->b_ffname = vim_strsave(opt->jo_term_name);
564 }
565 else if (argv != NULL((void*)0))
566 {
567 vim_free(curbuf->b_ffname);
568 curbuf->b_ffname = vim_strsave((char_u *)"!system");
569 }
570 else
571 {
572 int i;
573 size_t len;
574 char_u *cmd, *p;
575
576 if (argvar->v_type == VAR_STRING)
577 {
578 cmd = argvar->vval.v_string;
579 if (cmd == NULL((void*)0))
580 cmd = (char_u *)"";
581 else if (STRCMP(cmd, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("NONE")) == 0)
582 cmd = (char_u *)"pty";
583 }
584 else if (argvar->v_type != VAR_LIST
585 || argvar->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)
586 || argvar->vval.v_list->lv_len == 0
587 || (cmd = tv_get_string_chk(
588 &argvar->vval.v_list->lv_first->li_tv)) == NULL((void*)0))
589 cmd = (char_u*)"";
590
591 len = STRLEN(cmd)strlen((char *)(cmd)) + 10;
592 p = alloc(len);
593
594 for (i = 0; p != NULL((void*)0); ++i)
595 {
596 // Prepend a ! to the command name to avoid the buffer name equals
597 // the executable, otherwise ":w!" would overwrite it.
598 if (i == 0)
599 vim_snprintf((char *)p, len, "!%s", cmd);
600 else
601 vim_snprintf((char *)p, len, "!%s (%d)", cmd, i);
602 if (buflist_findname(p) == NULL((void*)0))
603 {
604 vim_free(curbuf->b_ffname);
605 curbuf->b_ffname = p;
606 break;
607 }
608 }
609 }
610 vim_free(curbuf->b_sfname);
611 curbuf->b_sfname = vim_strsave(curbuf->b_ffname);
612 curbuf->b_fname = curbuf->b_ffname;
613
614 apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFFILEPOST, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, curbuf);
615
616 if (opt->jo_term_opencmd != NULL((void*)0))
617 term->tl_opencmd = vim_strsave(opt->jo_term_opencmd);
618
619 if (opt->jo_eof_chars != NULL((void*)0))
620 term->tl_eof_chars = vim_strsave(opt->jo_eof_chars);
621
622 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"buftype", -1,
623 (char_u *)"terminal", OPT_FREE0x01|OPT_LOCAL0x04, 0);
624 // Avoid that 'buftype' is reset when this buffer is entered.
625 curbuf->b_p_initialized = TRUE1;
626
627 // Mark the buffer as not modifiable. It can only be made modifiable after
628 // the job finished.
629 curbuf->b_p_ma = FALSE0;
630
631 set_term_and_win_size(term, opt);
632#ifdef MSWIN
633 mch_memmove(orig_opt.jo_io, opt->jo_io, sizeof(orig_opt.jo_io))memmove((char *)(orig_opt.jo_io), (char *)(opt->jo_io), sizeof
(orig_opt.jo_io));
634#endif
635 setup_job_options(opt, term->tl_rows, term->tl_cols);
636
637 if (flags & TERM_START_NOJOB1)
638 return curbuf;
639
640#if defined(FEAT_SESSION)
641 // Remember the command for the session file.
642 if (opt->jo_term_norestore || argv != NULL((void*)0))
643 term->tl_command = vim_strsave((char_u *)"NONE");
644 else if (argvar->v_type == VAR_STRING)
645 {
646 char_u *cmd = argvar->vval.v_string;
647
648 if (cmd != NULL((void*)0) && STRCMP(cmd, p_sh)strcmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)(p_sh)) != 0)
649 term->tl_command = vim_strsave(cmd);
650 }
651 else if (argvar->v_type == VAR_LIST
652 && argvar->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)
653 && argvar->vval.v_list->lv_len > 0)
654 {
655 garray_T ga;
656 listitem_T *item;
657
658 ga_init2(&ga, 1, 100);
659 FOR_ALL_LIST_ITEMS(argvar->vval.v_list, item)for ((item) = (argvar->vval.v_list)->lv_first; (item) !=
((void*)0); (item) = (item)->li_next)
660 {
661 char_u *s = tv_get_string_chk(&item->li_tv);
662 char_u *p;
663
664 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
665 break;
666 p = vim_strsave_fnameescape(s, FALSE0);
667 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
668 break;
669 ga_concat(&ga, p);
670 vim_free(p);
671 ga_append(&ga, ' ');
672 }
673 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
674 {
675 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
676 term->tl_command = ga.ga_data;
677 }
678 else
679 ga_clear(&ga);
680 }
681#endif
682
683 if (opt->jo_term_kill != NULL((void*)0))
684 {
685 char_u *p = skiptowhite(opt->jo_term_kill);
686
687 term->tl_kill = vim_strnsave(opt->jo_term_kill, p - opt->jo_term_kill);
688 }
689
690 if (opt->jo_term_api != NULL((void*)0))
691 {
692 char_u *p = skiptowhite(opt->jo_term_api);
693
694 term->tl_api = vim_strnsave(opt->jo_term_api, p - opt->jo_term_api);
695 }
696 else
697 term->tl_api = vim_strsave((char_u *)"Tapi_");
698
699 if (opt->jo_set2 & JO2_TERM_HIGHLIGHT0x80000)
700 term->tl_highlight_name = vim_strsave(opt->jo_term_highlight);
701
702 // System dependent: setup the vterm and maybe start the job in it.
703 if (argv == NULL((void*)0)
704 && argvar->v_type == VAR_STRING
705 && argvar->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
706 && STRCMP(argvar->vval.v_string, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(argvar->vval.v_string), (char *)("NONE")) == 0)
707 res = create_pty_only(term, opt);
708 else
709 res = term_and_job_init(term, argvar, argv, opt, &orig_opt);
710
711 newbuf = curbuf;
712 if (res == OK1)
713 {
714 // Get and remember the size we ended up with. Update the pty.
715 vterm_get_size(term->tl_vterm, &term->tl_rows, &term->tl_cols);
716 term_report_winsize(term, term->tl_rows, term->tl_cols);
717#ifdef FEAT_GUI
718 if (term->tl_system)
719 {
720 // display first line below typed command
721 term->tl_toprow = msg_row + 1;
722 term->tl_dirty_row_end = 0;
723 }
724#endif
725
726 // Make sure we don't get stuck on sending keys to the job, it leads to
727 // a deadlock if the job is waiting for Vim to read.
728 channel_set_nonblock(term->tl_job->jv_channel, PART_IN);
729
730 if (old_curbuf != NULL((void*)0))
731 {
732 --curbuf->b_nwindows;
733 curbuf = old_curbuf;
734 curwin->w_buffer = curbuf;
735 ++curbuf->b_nwindows;
736 }
737 }
738 else
739 {
740 term_close_buffer(curbuf, old_curbuf);
741 return NULL((void*)0);
742 }
743
744 apply_autocmds(EVENT_TERMINALOPEN, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, newbuf);
745 if (!opt->jo_hidden && !(flags & TERM_START_SYSTEM4))
746 apply_autocmds(EVENT_TERMINALWINOPEN, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FALSE0, newbuf);
747 return newbuf;
748}
749
750/*
751 * ":terminal": open a terminal window and execute a job in it.
752 */
753 void
754ex_terminal(exarg_T *eap)
755{
756 typval_T argvar[2];
757 jobopt_T opt;
758 int opt_shell = FALSE0;
759 char_u *cmd;
760 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
761
762 init_job_options(&opt);
763
764 cmd = eap->arg;
765 while (*cmd == '+' && *(cmd + 1) == '+')
766 {
767 char_u *p, *ep;
768
769 cmd += 2;
770 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
771 ep = vim_strchr(cmd, '=');
772 if (ep != NULL((void*)0))
773 {
774 if (ep < p)
775 p = ep;
776 else
777 ep = NULL((void*)0);
778 }
779
780# define OPTARG_HAS(name) ((int)(p - cmd) == sizeof(name) - 1 \
781 && STRNICMP(cmd, name, sizeof(name) - 1)strncasecmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)(name), (size_t)(sizeof(name
) - 1)) == 0)
782 if (OPTARG_HAS("close"))
783 opt.jo_term_finish = 'c';
784 else if (OPTARG_HAS("noclose"))
785 opt.jo_term_finish = 'n';
786 else if (OPTARG_HAS("open"))
787 opt.jo_term_finish = 'o';
788 else if (OPTARG_HAS("curwin"))
789 opt.jo_curwin = 1;
790 else if (OPTARG_HAS("hidden"))
791 opt.jo_hidden = 1;
792 else if (OPTARG_HAS("norestore"))
793 opt.jo_term_norestore = 1;
794 else if (OPTARG_HAS("shell"))
795 opt_shell = TRUE1;
796 else if (OPTARG_HAS("kill") && ep != NULL((void*)0))
797 {
798 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_TERM_KILL0x4000;
799 opt.jo_term_kill = ep + 1;
800 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
801 }
802 else if (OPTARG_HAS("api"))
803 {
804 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_TERM_API0x40000;
805 if (ep != NULL((void*)0))
806 {
807 opt.jo_term_api = ep + 1;
808 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
809 }
810 else
811 opt.jo_term_api = NULL((void*)0);
812 }
813 else if (OPTARG_HAS("rows") && ep != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(ep[1])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((ep[1]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit))
814 {
815 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_TERM_ROWS0x0040;
816 opt.jo_term_rows = atoi((char *)ep + 1);
817 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
818 }
819 else if (OPTARG_HAS("cols") && ep != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(ep[1])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((ep[1]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit))
820 {
821 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_TERM_COLS0x0080;
822 opt.jo_term_cols = atoi((char *)ep + 1);
823 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
824 }
825 else if (OPTARG_HAS("eof") && ep != NULL((void*)0))
826 {
827 char_u *buf = NULL((void*)0);
828 char_u *keys;
829
830 vim_free(opt.jo_eof_chars);
831 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
832 *p = NUL'\000';
833 keys = replace_termcodes(ep + 1, &buf,
834 REPTERM_FROM_PART1 | REPTERM_DO_LT2 | REPTERM_SPECIAL4, NULL((void*)0));
835 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_EOF_CHARS0x1000;
836 opt.jo_eof_chars = vim_strsave(keys);
837 vim_free(buf);
838 *p = ' ';
839 }
840#ifdef MSWIN
841 else if ((int)(p - cmd) == 4 && STRNICMP(cmd, "type", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("type"), (size_t)(4)) == 0
842 && ep != NULL((void*)0))
843 {
844 int tty_type = NUL'\000';
845
846 p = skiptowhite(cmd);
847 if (STRNICMP(ep + 1, "winpty", p - (ep + 1))strncasecmp((char *)(ep + 1), (char *)("winpty"), (size_t)(p -
(ep + 1))) == 0)
848 tty_type = 'w';
849 else if (STRNICMP(ep + 1, "conpty", p - (ep + 1))strncasecmp((char *)(ep + 1), (char *)("conpty"), (size_t)(p -
(ep + 1))) == 0)
850 tty_type = 'c';
851 else
852 {
853 semsg(e_invargval, "type");
854 goto theend;
855 }
856 opt.jo_set2 |= JO2_TTY_TYPE0x10000;
857 opt.jo_tty_type = tty_type;
858 }
859#endif
860 else
861 {
862 if (*p)
863 *p = NUL'\000';
864 semsg(_("E181: Invalid attribute: %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E181: Invalid attribute: %s"
), 5), cmd);
865 goto theend;
866 }
867# undef OPTARG_HAS
868 cmd = skipwhite(p);
869 }
870 if (*cmd == NUL'\000')
871 {
872 // Make a copy of 'shell', an autocommand may change the option.
873 tofree = cmd = vim_strsave(p_sh);
874
875 // default to close when the shell exits
876 if (opt.jo_term_finish == NUL'\000')
877 opt.jo_term_finish = TL_FINISH_CLOSE'c';
878 }
879
880 if (eap->addr_count > 0)
881 {
882 // Write lines from current buffer to the job.
883 opt.jo_set |= JO_IN_IO0x40000 | JO_IN_BUF0x4000000 | JO_IN_TOP0x400000 | JO_IN_BOT0x800000;
884 opt.jo_io[PART_IN] = JIO_BUFFER;
885 opt.jo_io_buf[PART_IN] = curbuf->b_fnum;
886 opt.jo_in_top = eap->line1;
887 opt.jo_in_bot = eap->line2;
888 }
889
890 if (opt_shell && tofree == NULL((void*)0))
891 {
892#ifdef UNIX1
893 char **argv = NULL((void*)0);
894 char_u *tofree1 = NULL((void*)0);
895 char_u *tofree2 = NULL((void*)0);
896
897 // :term ++shell command
898 if (unix_build_argv(cmd, &argv, &tofree1, &tofree2) == OK1)
899 term_start(NULL((void*)0), argv, &opt, eap->forceit ? TERM_START_FORCEIT2 : 0);
900 vim_free(argv);
901 vim_free(tofree1);
902 vim_free(tofree2);
903 goto theend;
904#else
905# ifdef MSWIN
906 long_u cmdlen = STRLEN(p_sh)strlen((char *)(p_sh)) + STRLEN(p_shcf)strlen((char *)(p_shcf)) + STRLEN(cmd)strlen((char *)(cmd)) + 10;
907 char_u *newcmd;
908
909 newcmd = alloc(cmdlen);
910 if (newcmd == NULL((void*)0))
911 goto theend;
912 tofree = newcmd;
913 vim_snprintf((char *)newcmd, cmdlen, "%s %s %s", p_sh, p_shcf, cmd);
914 cmd = newcmd;
915# else
916 emsg(_("E279: Sorry, ++shell is not supported on this system")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E279: Sorry, ++shell is not supported on this system"
), 5));
917 goto theend;
918# endif
919#endif
920 }
921 argvar[0].v_type = VAR_STRING;
922 argvar[0].vval.v_string = cmd;
923 argvar[1].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
924 term_start(argvar, NULL((void*)0), &opt, eap->forceit ? TERM_START_FORCEIT2 : 0);
925
926theend:
927 vim_free(tofree);
928 vim_free(opt.jo_eof_chars);
929}
930
931#if defined(FEAT_SESSION) || defined(PROTO)
932/*
933 * Write a :terminal command to the session file to restore the terminal in
934 * window "wp".
935 * Return FAIL if writing fails.
936 */
937 int
938term_write_session(FILE *fd, win_T *wp, hashtab_T *terminal_bufs)
939{
940 const int bufnr = wp->w_buffer->b_fnum;
941 term_T *term = wp->w_buffer->b_term;
942
943 if (terminal_bufs != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_buffer->b_nwindows > 1)
944 {
945 // There are multiple views into this terminal buffer. We don't want to
946 // create the terminal multiple times. If it's the first time, create,
947 // otherwise link to the first buffer.
948 char id_as_str[NUMBUFLEN65];
949 hashitem_T *entry;
950
951 vim_snprintf(id_as_str, sizeof(id_as_str), "%d", bufnr);
952
953 entry = hash_find(terminal_bufs, (char_u *)id_as_str);
954 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(entry)((entry)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (entry)->hi_key == &
hash_removed))
955 {
956 // we've already opened this terminal buffer
957 if (fprintf(fd, "execute 'buffer ' . s:term_buf_%d", bufnr) < 0)
958 return FAIL0;
959 return put_eol(fd);
960 }
961 }
962
963 // Create the terminal and run the command. This is not without
964 // risk, but let's assume the user only creates a session when this
965 // will be OK.
966 if (fprintf(fd, "terminal ++curwin ++cols=%d ++rows=%d ",
967 term->tl_cols, term->tl_rows) < 0)
968 return FAIL0;
969#ifdef MSWIN
970 if (fprintf(fd, "++type=%s ", term->tl_job->jv_tty_type) < 0)
971 return FAIL0;
972#endif
973 if (term->tl_command != NULL((void*)0) && fputs((char *)term->tl_command, fd) < 0)
974 return FAIL0;
975 if (put_eol(fd) != OK1)
976 return FAIL0;
977
978 if (fprintf(fd, "let s:term_buf_%d = bufnr()", bufnr) < 0)
979 return FAIL0;
980
981 if (terminal_bufs != NULL((void*)0) && wp->w_buffer->b_nwindows > 1)
982 {
983 char *hash_key = alloc(NUMBUFLEN65);
984
985 vim_snprintf(hash_key, NUMBUFLEN65, "%d", bufnr);
986 hash_add(terminal_bufs, (char_u *)hash_key);
987 }
988
989 return put_eol(fd);
990}

992/*
993 * Return TRUE if "buf" has a terminal that should be restored.
994 */
995 int
996term_should_restore(buf_T *buf)
997{
998 term_T *term = buf->b_term;
999
1000 return term != NULL((void*)0) && (term->tl_command == NULL((void*)0)
1001 || STRCMP(term->tl_command, "NONE")strcmp((char *)(term->tl_command), (char *)("NONE")) != 0);
1002}
1003#endif
1004
1005/*
1006 * Free the scrollback buffer for "term".
1007 */
1008 static void
1009free_scrollback(term_T *term)
1010{
1011 int i;
1012
1013 for (i = 0; i < term->tl_scrollback.ga_len; ++i)
1014 vim_free(((sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data + i)->sb_cells);
1015 ga_clear(&term->tl_scrollback);
1016 for (i = 0; i < term->tl_scrollback_postponed.ga_len; ++i)
1017 vim_free(((sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback_postponed.ga_data + i)->sb_cells);
1018 ga_clear(&term->tl_scrollback_postponed);
1019}
1020
1021
1022// Terminals that need to be freed soon.
1023static term_T *terminals_to_free = NULL((void*)0);
1024
1025/*
1026 * Free a terminal and everything it refers to.
1027 * Kills the job if there is one.
1028 * Called when wiping out a buffer.
1029 * The actual terminal structure is freed later in free_unused_terminals(),
1030 * because callbacks may wipe out a buffer while the terminal is still
1031 * referenced.
1032 */
1033 void
1034free_terminal(buf_T *buf)
1035{
1036 term_T *term = buf->b_term;
1037 term_T *tp;
1038
1039 if (term == NULL((void*)0))
1040 return;
1041
1042 // Unlink the terminal form the list of terminals.
1043 if (first_term == term)
1044 first_term = term->tl_next;
1045 else
1046 for (tp = first_term; tp->tl_next != NULL((void*)0); tp = tp->tl_next)
1047 if (tp->tl_next == term)
1048 {
1049 tp->tl_next = term->tl_next;
1050 break;
1051 }
1052
1053 if (term->tl_job != NULL((void*)0))
1054 {
1055 if (term->tl_job->jv_status != JOB_ENDED
1056 && term->tl_job->jv_status != JOB_FINISHED
1057 && term->tl_job->jv_status != JOB_FAILED)
1058 job_stop(term->tl_job, NULL((void*)0), "kill");
1059 job_unref(term->tl_job);
1060 }
1061 term->tl_next = terminals_to_free;
1062 terminals_to_free = term;
1063
1064 buf->b_term = NULL((void*)0);
1065 if (in_terminal_loop == term)
1066 in_terminal_loop = NULL((void*)0);
1067}
1068
1069 void
1070free_unused_terminals()
1071{
1072 while (terminals_to_free != NULL((void*)0))
1073 {
1074 term_T *term = terminals_to_free;
1075
1076 terminals_to_free = term->tl_next;
1077
1078 free_scrollback(term);
1079 ga_clear(&term->tl_osc_buf);
1080
1081 term_free_vterm(term);
1082 vim_free(term->tl_api);
1083 vim_free(term->tl_title);
1084#ifdef FEAT_SESSION
1085 vim_free(term->tl_command);
1086#endif
1087 vim_free(term->tl_kill);
1088 vim_free(term->tl_status_text);
1089 vim_free(term->tl_opencmd);
1090 vim_free(term->tl_eof_chars);
1091 vim_free(term->tl_arg0_cmd);
1092#ifdef MSWIN
1093 if (term->tl_out_fd != NULL((void*)0))
1094 fclose(term->tl_out_fd);
1095#endif
1096 vim_free(term->tl_highlight_name);
1097 vim_free(term->tl_cursor_color);
1098 vim_free(term);
1099 }
1100}
1101
1102/*
1103 * Get the part that is connected to the tty. Normally this is PART_IN, but
1104 * when writing buffer lines to the job it can be another. This makes it
1105 * possible to do "1,5term vim -".
1106 */
1107 static ch_part_T
1108get_tty_part(term_T *term UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
1109{
1110#ifdef UNIX1
1111 ch_part_T parts[3] = {PART_IN, PART_OUT, PART_ERR};
1112 int i;
1113
1114 for (i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
1115 {
1116 int fd = term->tl_job->jv_channel->ch_part[parts[i]].ch_fd;
1117
1118 if (mch_isatty(fd))
1119 return parts[i];
1120 }
1121#endif
1122 return PART_IN;
1123}
1124
1125/*
1126 * Write job output "msg[len]" to the vterm.
1127 */
1128 static void
1129term_write_job_output(term_T *term, char_u *msg, size_t len)
1130{
1131 VTerm *vterm = term->tl_vterm;
1132 size_t prevlen = vterm_output_get_buffer_current(vterm);
1133
1134 vterm_input_write(vterm, (char *)msg, len);
1135
1136 // flush vterm buffer when vterm responded to control sequence
1137 if (prevlen != vterm_output_get_buffer_current(vterm))
1138 {
1139 char buf[KEY_BUF_LEN200];
1140 size_t curlen = vterm_output_read(vterm, buf, KEY_BUF_LEN200);
1141
1142 if (curlen > 0)
1143 channel_send(term->tl_job->jv_channel, get_tty_part(term),
1144 (char_u *)buf, (int)curlen, NULL((void*)0));
1145 }
1146
1147 // this invokes the damage callbacks
1148 vterm_screen_flush_damage(vterm_obtain_screen(vterm));
1149}
1150
1151 static void
1152update_cursor(term_T *term, int redraw)
1153{
1154 if (term->tl_normal_mode)
1155 return;
1156#ifdef FEAT_GUI
1157 if (term->tl_system)
1158 windgoto(term->tl_cursor_pos.row + term->tl_toprow,
1159 term->tl_cursor_pos.col);
1160 else
1161#endif
1162 setcursor();
1163 if (redraw)
1164 {
1165 if (term->tl_buffer == curbuf && term->tl_cursor_visible)
1166 cursor_on();
1167 out_flush();
1168#ifdef FEAT_GUI
1169 if (gui.in_use)
1170 {
1171 gui_update_cursor(FALSE0, FALSE0);
1172 gui_mch_flush();
1173 }
1174#endif
1175 }
1176}
1177
1178/*
1179 * Invoked when "msg" output from a job was received. Write it to the terminal
1180 * of "buffer".
1181 */
1182 void
1183write_to_term(buf_T *buffer, char_u *msg, channel_T *channel)
1184{
1185 size_t len = STRLEN(msg)strlen((char *)(msg));
1186 term_T *term = buffer->b_term;
1187
1188#ifdef MSWIN
1189 // Win32: Cannot redirect output of the job, intercept it here and write to
1190 // the file.
1191 if (term->tl_out_fd != NULL((void*)0))
1192 {
1193 ch_log(channel, "Writing %d bytes to output file", (int)len);
1194 fwrite(msg, len, 1, term->tl_out_fd);
1195 return;
1196 }
1197#endif
1198
1199 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
1200 {
1201 ch_log(channel, "NOT writing %d bytes to terminal", (int)len);
1202 return;
1203 }
1204 ch_log(channel, "writing %d bytes to terminal", (int)len);
1205 term_write_job_output(term, msg, len);
1206
1207#ifdef FEAT_GUI
1208 if (term->tl_system)
1209 {
1210 // show system output, scrolling up the screen as needed
1211 update_system_term(term);
1212 update_cursor(term, TRUE1);
1213 }
1214 else
1215#endif
1216 // In Terminal-Normal mode we are displaying the buffer, not the terminal
1217 // contents, thus no screen update is needed.
1218 if (!term->tl_normal_mode)
1219 {
1220 // Don't use update_screen() when editing the command line, it gets
1221 // cleared.
1222 // TODO: only update once in a while.
1223 ch_log(term->tl_job->jv_channel, "updating screen");
1224 if (buffer == curbuf && (State & CMDLINE0x08) == 0)
1225 {
1226 update_screen(VALID_NO_UPDATE5);
1227 // update_screen() can be slow, check the terminal wasn't closed
1228 // already
1229 if (buffer == curbuf && curbuf->b_term != NULL((void*)0))
1230 update_cursor(curbuf->b_term, TRUE1);
1231 }
1232 else
1233 redraw_after_callback(TRUE1);
1234 }
1235}
1236
1237/*
1238 * Send a mouse position and click to the vterm
1239 */
1240 static int
1241term_send_mouse(VTerm *vterm, int button, int pressed)
1242{
1243 VTermModifier mod = VTERM_MOD_NONE;
1244 int row = mouse_row - W_WINROW(curwin)(curwin->w_winrow + curwin->w_winbar_height);
1245 int col = mouse_col - curwin->w_wincol;
1246
1247#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
1248 if (popup_is_popup(curwin))
1249 {
1250 row -= popup_top_extra(curwin);
1251 col -= popup_left_extra(curwin);
1252 }
1253#endif
1254 vterm_mouse_move(vterm, row, col, mod);
1255 if (button != 0)
1256 vterm_mouse_button(vterm, button, pressed, mod);
1257 return TRUE1;
1258}
1259
1260static int enter_mouse_col = -1;
1261static int enter_mouse_row = -1;
1262
1263/*
1264 * Handle a mouse click, drag or release.
1265 * Return TRUE when a mouse event is sent to the terminal.
1266 */
1267 static int
1268term_mouse_click(VTerm *vterm, int key)
1269{
1270#if defined(FEAT_CLIPBOARD)
1271 // For modeless selection mouse drag and release events are ignored, unless
1272 // they are preceded with a mouse down event
1273 static int ignore_drag_release = TRUE1;
1274 VTermMouseState mouse_state;
1275
1276 vterm_state_get_mousestate(vterm_obtain_state(vterm), &mouse_state);
1277 if (mouse_state.flags == 0)
1278 {
1279 // Terminal is not using the mouse, use modeless selection.
1280 switch (key)
1281 {
1282 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))):
1283 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
1284 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))):
1285 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))):
1286 // Ignore drag and release events when the button-down wasn't
1287 // seen before.
1288 if (ignore_drag_release)
1289 {
1290 int save_mouse_col, save_mouse_row;
1291
1292 if (enter_mouse_col < 0)
1293 break;
1294
1295 // mouse click in the window gave us focus, handle that
1296 // click now
1297 save_mouse_col = mouse_col;
1298 save_mouse_row = mouse_row;
1299 mouse_col = enter_mouse_col;
1300 mouse_row = enter_mouse_row;
1301 clip_modeless(MOUSE_LEFT0x00, TRUE1, FALSE0);
1302 mouse_col = save_mouse_col;
1303 mouse_row = save_mouse_row;
1304 }
1305 // FALLTHROUGH
1306 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))):
1307 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))):
1308 if (key == K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))) || key == K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))))
1309 ignore_drag_release = TRUE1;
1310 else
1311 ignore_drag_release = FALSE0;
1312 // Should we call mouse_has() here?
1313 if (clip_star.available)
1314 {
1315 int button, is_click, is_drag;
1316
1317 button = get_mouse_button(KEY2TERMCAP1(key)(((unsigned)(-(key)) >> 8) & 0xff),
1318 &is_click, &is_drag);
1319 if (mouse_model_popup() && button == MOUSE_LEFT0x00
1320 && (mod_mask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02))
1321 {
1322 // Translate shift-left to right button.
1323 button = MOUSE_RIGHT0x02;
1324 mod_mask &= ~MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02;
1325 }
1326 clip_modeless(button, is_click, is_drag);
1327 }
1328 break;
1329
1330 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))):
1331 if (clip_star.available)
1332 insert_reg('*', TRUE1);
1333 break;
1334 }
1335 enter_mouse_col = -1;
1336 return FALSE0;
1337 }
1338#endif
1339 enter_mouse_col = -1;
1340
1341 switch (key)
1342 {
1343 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))):
1344 case K_LEFTMOUSE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE_NM) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 1, 1); break;
1345 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 1, 1); break;
1346 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
1347 case K_LEFTRELEASE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE_NM) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 1, 0); break;
1348 case K_MOUSEMOVE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEMOVE) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 0, 0); break;
1349 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 2, 1); break;
1350 case K_MIDDLEDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEDRAG) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 2, 1); break;
1351 case K_MIDDLERELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLERELEASE) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 2, 0); break;
1352 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 3, 1); break;
1353 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 3, 1); break;
1354 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))): term_send_mouse(vterm, 3, 0); break;
1355 }
1356 return TRUE1;
1357}
1358
1359/*
1360 * Convert typed key "c" with modifiers "modmask" into bytes to send to the
1361 * job.
1362 * Return the number of bytes in "buf".
1363 */
1364 static int
1365term_convert_key(term_T *term, int c, int modmask, char *buf)
1366{
1367 VTerm *vterm = term->tl_vterm;
1368 VTermKey key = VTERM_KEY_NONE;
1369 VTermModifier mod = VTERM_MOD_NONE;
1370 int other = FALSE0;
1371
1372 switch (c)
1373 {
1374 // don't use VTERM_KEY_ENTER, it may do an unwanted conversion
1375
1376 // don't use VTERM_KEY_BACKSPACE, it always
1377 // becomes 0x7f DEL
1378 case K_BS(-(('k') + ((int)('b') << 8))): c = term_backspace_char; break;
1379
1380 case ESC'\033': key = VTERM_KEY_ESCAPE; break;
1381 case K_DEL(-(('k') + ((int)('D') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_DEL; break;
1382 case K_DOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('d') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_DOWN; break;
1383 case K_S_DOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_DOWN) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1384 key = VTERM_KEY_DOWN; break;
1385 case K_END(-(('@') + ((int)('7') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_END; break;
1386 case K_S_END(-(('*') + ((int)('7') << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1387 key = VTERM_KEY_END; break;
1388 case K_C_END(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_END) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_CTRL;
1389 key = VTERM_KEY_END; break;
1390 case K_F10(-(('k') + ((int)(';') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(10)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(10)); break;
1391 case K_F11(-(('F') + ((int)('1') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(11)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(11)); break;
1392 case K_F12(-(('F') + ((int)('2') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(12)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(12)); break;
1393 case K_F1(-(('k') + ((int)('1') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(1)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(1)); break;
1394 case K_F2(-(('k') + ((int)('2') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(2)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(2)); break;
1395 case K_F3(-(('k') + ((int)('3') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(3)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(3)); break;
1396 case K_F4(-(('k') + ((int)('4') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(4)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(4)); break;
1397 case K_F5(-(('k') + ((int)('5') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(5)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(5)); break;
1398 case K_F6(-(('k') + ((int)('6') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(6)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(6)); break;
1399 case K_F7(-(('k') + ((int)('7') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(7)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(7)); break;
1400 case K_F8(-(('k') + ((int)('8') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(8)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(8)); break;
1401 case K_F9(-(('k') + ((int)('9') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(9)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(9)); break;
1402 case K_HOME(-(('k') + ((int)('h') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_HOME; break;
1403 case K_S_HOME(-(('#') + ((int)('2') << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1404 key = VTERM_KEY_HOME; break;
1405 case K_C_HOME(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_HOME) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_CTRL;
1406 key = VTERM_KEY_HOME; break;
1407 case K_INS(-(('k') + ((int)('I') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_INS; break;
1408 case K_K0(-(('K') + ((int)('C') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_0; break;
1409 case K_K1(-(('K') + ((int)('D') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_1; break;
1410 case K_K2(-(('K') + ((int)('E') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_2; break;
1411 case K_K3(-(('K') + ((int)('F') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_3; break;
1412 case K_K4(-(('K') + ((int)('G') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_4; break;
1413 case K_K5(-(('K') + ((int)('H') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_5; break;
1414 case K_K6(-(('K') + ((int)('I') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_6; break;
1415 case K_K7(-(('K') + ((int)('J') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_7; break;
1416 case K_K8(-(('K') + ((int)('K') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_8; break;
1417 case K_K9(-(('K') + ((int)('L') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_9; break;
1418 case K_KDEL(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KDEL) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_DEL; break; // TODO
1419 case K_KDIVIDE(-(('K') + ((int)('8') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_DIVIDE; break;
1420 case K_KEND(-(('K') + ((int)('4') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_1; break; // TODO
1421 case K_KENTER(-(('K') + ((int)('A') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_ENTER; break;
1422 case K_KHOME(-(('K') + ((int)('1') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_7; break; // TODO
1423 case K_KINS(-((253) + ((int)(KE_KINS) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_0; break; // TODO
1424 case K_KMINUS(-(('K') + ((int)('7') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_MINUS; break;
1425 case K_KMULTIPLY(-(('K') + ((int)('9') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_MULT; break;
1426 case K_KPAGEDOWN(-(('K') + ((int)('5') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_3; break; // TODO
1427 case K_KPAGEUP(-(('K') + ((int)('3') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_9; break; // TODO
1428 case K_KPLUS(-(('K') + ((int)('6') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_PLUS; break;
1429 case K_KPOINT(-(('K') + ((int)('B') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_KP_PERIOD; break;
1430 case K_LEFT(-(('k') + ((int)('l') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_LEFT; break;
1431 case K_S_LEFT(-(('#') + ((int)('4') << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1432 key = VTERM_KEY_LEFT; break;
1433 case K_C_LEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_LEFT) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_CTRL;
1434 key = VTERM_KEY_LEFT; break;
1435 case K_PAGEDOWN(-(('k') + ((int)('N') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_PAGEDOWN; break;
1436 case K_PAGEUP(-(('k') + ((int)('P') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_PAGEUP; break;
1437 case K_RIGHT(-(('k') + ((int)('r') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_RIGHT; break;
1438 case K_S_RIGHT(-(('%') + ((int)('i') << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1439 key = VTERM_KEY_RIGHT; break;
1440 case K_C_RIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_C_RIGHT) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_CTRL;
1441 key = VTERM_KEY_RIGHT; break;
1442 case K_UP(-(('k') + ((int)('u') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_UP; break;
1443 case K_S_UP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_S_UP) << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1444 key = VTERM_KEY_UP; break;
1445 case TAB'\011': key = VTERM_KEY_TAB; break;
1446 case K_S_TAB(-(('k') + ((int)('B') << 8))): mod = VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1447 key = VTERM_KEY_TAB; break;
1448
1449 case K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8))): other = term_send_mouse(vterm, 5, 1); break;
1450 case K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))): other = term_send_mouse(vterm, 4, 1); break;
1451 case K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))): other = term_send_mouse(vterm, 7, 1); break;
1452 case K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))): other = term_send_mouse(vterm, 6, 1); break;
1453
1454 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))):
1455 case K_LEFTMOUSE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE_NM) << 8))):
1456 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))):
1457 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
1458 case K_LEFTRELEASE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE_NM) << 8))):
1459 case K_MOUSEMOVE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEMOVE) << 8))):
1460 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))):
1461 case K_MIDDLEDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEDRAG) << 8))):
1462 case K_MIDDLERELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLERELEASE) << 8))):
1463 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))):
1464 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))):
1465 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))): if (!term_mouse_click(vterm, c))
1466 return 0;
1467 other = TRUE1;
1468 break;
1469
1470 case K_X1MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1MOUSE) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1471 case K_X1DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1DRAG) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1472 case K_X1RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1RELEASE) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1473 case K_X2MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2MOUSE) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1474 case K_X2DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2DRAG) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1475 case K_X2RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2RELEASE) << 8))): /* TODO */ return 0;
1476
1477 case K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))): return 0;
1478 case K_NOP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_NOP) << 8))): return 0;
1479 case K_UNDO(-(('&') + ((int)('8') << 8))): return 0;
1480 case K_HELP(-(('%') + ((int)('1') << 8))): return 0;
1481 case K_XF1(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF1) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(1)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(1)); break;
1482 case K_XF2(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF2) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(2)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(2)); break;
1483 case K_XF3(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF3) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(3)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(3)); break;
1484 case K_XF4(-((253) + ((int)(KE_XF4) << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(4)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(4)); break;
1485 case K_SELECT(-((245) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): return 0;
1486#ifdef FEAT_GUI
1487 case K_VER_SCROLLBAR(-((249) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): return 0;
1488 case K_HOR_SCROLLBAR(-((248) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): return 0;
1489#endif
1490#ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
1491 case K_TABLINE(-((240) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): return 0;
1492 case K_TABMENU(-((239) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))): return 0;
1493#endif
1494#ifdef FEAT_NETBEANS_INTG1
1495 case K_F21(-(('F') + ((int)('B') << 8))): key = VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION(21)(VTERM_KEY_FUNCTION_0+(21)); break;
1496#endif
1497#ifdef FEAT_DND
1498 case K_DROP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_DROP) << 8))): return 0;
1499#endif
1500 case K_CURSORHOLD(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CURSORHOLD) << 8))): return 0;
1501 case K_PS(-(('P') + ((int)('S') << 8))): vterm_keyboard_start_paste(vterm);
1502 other = TRUE1;
1503 break;
1504 case K_PE(-(('P') + ((int)('E') << 8))): vterm_keyboard_end_paste(vterm);
1505 other = TRUE1;
1506 break;
1507 }
1508
1509 // add modifiers for the typed key
1510 if (modmask & MOD_MASK_SHIFT0x02)
1511 mod |= VTERM_MOD_SHIFT;
1512 if (modmask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04)
1513 mod |= VTERM_MOD_CTRL;
1514 if (modmask & (MOD_MASK_ALT0x08 | MOD_MASK_META0x10))
1515 mod |= VTERM_MOD_ALT;
1516
1517 /*
1518 * Convert special keys to vterm keys:
1519 * - Write keys to vterm: vterm_keyboard_key()
1520 * - Write output to channel.
1521 */
1522 if (key != VTERM_KEY_NONE)
1523 // Special key, let vterm convert it.
1524 vterm_keyboard_key(vterm, key, mod);
1525 else if (!other)
1526 // Normal character, let vterm convert it.
1527 vterm_keyboard_unichar(vterm, c, mod);
1528
1529 // Read back the converted escape sequence.
1530 return (int)vterm_output_read(vterm, buf, KEY_BUF_LEN200);
1531}
1532
1533/*
1534 * Return TRUE if the job for "term" is still running.
1535 * If "check_job_status" is TRUE update the job status.
1536 * NOTE: "term" may be freed by callbacks.
1537 */
1538 static int
1539term_job_running_check(term_T *term, int check_job_status)
1540{
1541 // Also consider the job finished when the channel is closed, to avoid a
1542 // race condition when updating the title.
1543 if (term != NULL((void*)0)
1544 && term->tl_job != NULL((void*)0)
1545 && channel_is_open(term->tl_job->jv_channel))
1546 {
1547 job_T *job = term->tl_job;
1548
1549 // Careful: Checking the job status may invoked callbacks, which close
1550 // the buffer and terminate "term". However, "job" will not be freed
1551 // yet.
1552 if (check_job_status)
1553 job_status(job);
1554 return (job->jv_status == JOB_STARTED
1555 || (job->jv_channel != NULL((void*)0) && job->jv_channel->ch_keep_open));
1556 }
1557 return FALSE0;
1558}
1559
1560/*
1561 * Return TRUE if the job for "term" is still running.
1562 */
1563 int
1564term_job_running(term_T *term)
1565{
1566 return term_job_running_check(term, FALSE0);
1567}
1568
1569/*
1570 * Return TRUE if "term" has an active channel and used ":term NONE".
1571 */
1572 int
1573term_none_open(term_T *term)
1574{
1575 // Also consider the job finished when the channel is closed, to avoid a
1576 // race condition when updating the title.
1577 return term != NULL((void*)0)
1578 && term->tl_job != NULL((void*)0)
1579 && channel_is_open(term->tl_job->jv_channel)
1580 && term->tl_job->jv_channel->ch_keep_open;
1581}
1582
1583/*
1584 * Used when exiting: kill the job in "buf" if so desired.
1585 * Return OK when the job finished.
1586 * Return FAIL when the job is still running.
1587 */
1588 int
1589term_try_stop_job(buf_T *buf)
1590{
1591 int count;
1592 char *how = (char *)buf->b_term->tl_kill;
1593
1594#if defined(FEAT_GUI_DIALOG) || defined(FEAT_CON_DIALOG)
1595 if ((how == NULL((void*)0) || *how == NUL'\000')
1596 && (p_confirm || (cmdmod.cmod_flags & CMOD_CONFIRM0x0080)))
1597 {
1598 char_u buff[DIALOG_MSG_SIZE1000];
1599 int ret;
1600
1601 dialog_msg(buff, _("Kill job in \"%s\"?")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Kill job in \"%s\"?"), 5), buf_get_fname(buf));
1602 ret = vim_dialog_yesnocancel(VIM_QUESTION4, NULL((void*)0), buff, 1);
1603 if (ret == VIM_YES2)
1604 how = "kill";
1605 else if (ret == VIM_CANCEL4)
1606 return FAIL0;
1607 }
1608#endif
1609 if (how == NULL((void*)0) || *how == NUL'\000')
1610 return FAIL0;
1611
1612 job_stop(buf->b_term->tl_job, NULL((void*)0), how);
1613
1614 // wait for up to a second for the job to die
1615 for (count = 0; count < 100; ++count)
1616 {
1617 job_T *job;
1618
1619 // buffer, terminal and job may be cleaned up while waiting
1620 if (!buf_valid(buf)
1621 || buf->b_term == NULL((void*)0)
1622 || buf->b_term->tl_job == NULL((void*)0))
1623 return OK1;
1624 job = buf->b_term->tl_job;
1625
1626 // Call job_status() to update jv_status. It may cause the job to be
1627 // cleaned up but it won't be freed.
1628 job_status(job);
1629 if (job->jv_status >= JOB_ENDED)
1630 return OK1;
1631
1632 ui_delay(10L, TRUE1);
1633 term_flush_messages();
1634 }
1635 return FAIL0;
1636}
1637
1638/*
1639 * Add the last line of the scrollback buffer to the buffer in the window.
1640 */
1641 static void
1642add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term_T *term, char_u *text, int len)
1643{
1644 buf_T *buf = term->tl_buffer;
1645 int empty = (buf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY1);
1646 linenr_T lnum = buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
1647
1648#ifdef MSWIN
1649 if (!enc_utf8 && enc_codepage > 0)
1650 {
1651 WCHAR *ret = NULL((void*)0);
1652 int length = 0;
1653
1654 MultiByteToWideChar_alloc(CP_UTF8, 0, (char*)text, len + 1,
1655 &ret, &length);
1656 if (ret != NULL((void*)0))
1657 {
1658 WideCharToMultiByte_alloc(enc_codepage, 0,
1659 ret, length, (char **)&text, &len, 0, 0);
1660 vim_free(ret);
1661 ml_append_buf(term->tl_buffer, lnum, text, len, FALSE0);
1662 vim_free(text);
1663 }
1664 }
1665 else
1666#endif
1667 ml_append_buf(term->tl_buffer, lnum, text, len + 1, FALSE0);
1668 if (empty)
1669 {
1670 // Delete the empty line that was in the empty buffer.
1671 curbuf = buf;
1672 ml_delete(1);
1673 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
1674 }
1675}
1676
1677 static void
1678cell2cellattr(const VTermScreenCell *cell, cellattr_T *attr)
1679{
1680 attr->width = cell->width;
1681 attr->attrs = cell->attrs;
1682 attr->fg = cell->fg;
1683 attr->bg = cell->bg;
1684}
1685
1686 static int
1687equal_celattr(cellattr_T *a, cellattr_T *b)
1688{
1689 // We only compare the RGB colors, ignoring the ANSI index and type.
1690 // Thus black set explicitly is equal the background black.
1691 return a->fg.red == b->fg.red
1692 && a->fg.green == b->fg.green
1693 && a->fg.blue == b->fg.blue
1694 && a->bg.red == b->bg.red
1695 && a->bg.green == b->bg.green
1696 && a->bg.blue == b->bg.blue;
1697}
1698
1699/*
1700 * Add an empty scrollback line to "term". When "lnum" is not zero, add the
1701 * line at this position. Otherwise at the end.
1702 */
1703 static int
1704add_empty_scrollback(term_T *term, cellattr_T *fill_attr, int lnum)
1705{
1706 if (ga_grow(&term->tl_scrollback, 1) == OK1)
1707 {
1708 sb_line_T *line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data
1709 + term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
1710
1711 if (lnum > 0)
1712 {
1713 int i;
1714
1715 for (i = 0; i < term->tl_scrollback.ga_len - lnum; ++i)
1716 {
1717 *line = *(line - 1);
1718 --line;
1719 }
1720 }
1721 line->sb_cols = 0;
1722 line->sb_cells = NULL((void*)0);
1723 line->sb_fill_attr = *fill_attr;
1724 ++term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
1725 return OK1;
1726 }
1727 return FALSE0;
1728}
1729
1730/*
1731 * Remove the terminal contents from the scrollback and the buffer.
1732 * Used before adding a new scrollback line or updating the buffer for lines
1733 * displayed in the terminal.
1734 */
1735 static void
1736cleanup_scrollback(term_T *term)
1737{
1738 sb_line_T *line;
1739 garray_T *gap;
1740
1741 curbuf = term->tl_buffer;
1742 gap = &term->tl_scrollback;
1743 while (curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count > term->tl_scrollback_scrolled
1744 && gap->ga_len > 0)
1745 {
1746 ml_delete(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count);
1747 line = (sb_line_T *)gap->ga_data + gap->ga_len - 1;
1748 vim_free(line->sb_cells);
1749 --gap->ga_len;
1750 }
1751 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
1752 if (curbuf == term->tl_buffer)
1753 check_cursor();
1754}
1755
1756/*
1757 * Add the current lines of the terminal to scrollback and to the buffer.
1758 */
1759 static void
1760update_snapshot(term_T *term)
1761{
1762 VTermScreen *screen;
1763 int len;
1764 int lines_skipped = 0;
1765 VTermPos pos;
1766 VTermScreenCell cell;
1767 cellattr_T fill_attr, new_fill_attr;
1768 cellattr_T *p;
1769
1770 ch_log(term->tl_job == NULL((void*)0) ? NULL((void*)0) : term->tl_job->jv_channel,
1771 "Adding terminal window snapshot to buffer");
1772
1773 // First remove the lines that were appended before, they might be
1774 // outdated.
1775 cleanup_scrollback(term);
1776
1777 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(term->tl_vterm);
1778 fill_attr = new_fill_attr = term->tl_default_color;
1779 for (pos.row = 0; pos.row < term->tl_rows; ++pos.row)
1780 {
1781 len = 0;
1782 for (pos.col = 0; pos.col < term->tl_cols; ++pos.col)
1783 if (vterm_screen_get_cell(screen, pos, &cell) != 0
1784 && cell.chars[0] != NUL'\000')
1785 {
1786 len = pos.col + 1;
1787 new_fill_attr = term->tl_default_color;
1788 }
1789 else
1790 // Assume the last attr is the filler attr.
1791 cell2cellattr(&cell, &new_fill_attr);
1792
1793 if (len == 0 && equal_celattr(&new_fill_attr, &fill_attr))
1794 ++lines_skipped;
1795 else
1796 {
1797 while (lines_skipped > 0)
1798 {
1799 // Line was skipped, add an empty line.
1800 --lines_skipped;
1801 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &fill_attr, 0) == OK1)
1802 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, (char_u *)"", 0);
1803 }
1804
1805 if (len == 0)
1806 p = NULL((void*)0);
1807 else
1808 p = ALLOC_MULT(cellattr_T, len)(cellattr_T *)alloc(sizeof(cellattr_T) * (len));
1809 if ((p != NULL((void*)0) || len == 0)
1810 && ga_grow(&term->tl_scrollback, 1) == OK1)
1811 {
1812 garray_T ga;
1813 int width;
1814 sb_line_T *line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data
1815 + term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
1816
1817 ga_init2(&ga, 1, 100);
1818 for (pos.col = 0; pos.col < len; pos.col += width)
1819 {
1820 if (vterm_screen_get_cell(screen, pos, &cell) == 0)
1821 {
1822 width = 1;
1823 CLEAR_POINTER(p + pos.col)memset(((p + pos.col)), (0), (sizeof(*(p + pos.col))));
1824 if (ga_grow(&ga, 1) == OK1)
1825 ga.ga_len += utf_char2bytes(' ',
1826 (char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len);
1827 }
1828 else
1829 {
1830 width = cell.width;
1831
1832 cell2cellattr(&cell, &p[pos.col]);
1833 if (width == 2)
1834 // second cell of double-width character has the
1835 // same attributes.
1836 p[pos.col + 1] = p[pos.col];
1837
1838 // Each character can be up to 6 bytes.
1839 if (ga_grow(&ga, VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6 * 6) == OK1)
1840 {
1841 int i;
1842 int c;
1843
1844 for (i = 0; (c = cell.chars[i]) > 0 || i == 0; ++i)
1845 ga.ga_len += utf_char2bytes(c == NUL'\000' ? ' ' : c,
1846 (char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len);
1847 }
1848 }
1849 }
1850 line->sb_cols = len;
1851 line->sb_cells = p;
1852 line->sb_fill_attr = new_fill_attr;
1853 fill_attr = new_fill_attr;
1854 ++term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
1855
1856 if (ga_grow(&ga, 1) == FAIL0)
1857 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, (char_u *)"", 0);
1858 else
1859 {
1860 *((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len) = NUL'\000';
1861 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, ga.ga_data, ga.ga_len);
1862 }
1863 ga_clear(&ga);
1864 }
1865 else
1866 vim_free(p);
1867 }
1868 }
1869
1870 // Add trailing empty lines.
1871 for (pos.row = term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
1872 pos.row < term->tl_scrollback_scrolled + term->tl_cursor_pos.row;
1873 ++pos.row)
1874 {
1875 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &fill_attr, 0) == OK1)
1876 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, (char_u *)"", 0);
1877 }
1878
1879 term->tl_dirty_snapshot = FALSE0;
1880#ifdef FEAT_TIMERS
1881 term->tl_timer_set = FALSE0;
1882#endif
1883}
1884
1885/*
1886 * Loop over all windows in the current tab, and also curwin, which is not
1887 * encountered when using a terminal in a popup window.
1888 * Return TRUE if "*wp" was set to the next window.
1889 */
1890 static int
1891for_all_windows_and_curwin(win_T **wp, int *did_curwin)
1892{
1893 if (*wp == NULL((void*)0))
1894 *wp = firstwin;
1895 else if ((*wp)->w_next != NULL((void*)0))
1896 *wp = (*wp)->w_next;
1897 else if (!*did_curwin)
1898 *wp = curwin;
1899 else
1900 return FALSE0;
1901 if (*wp == curwin)
1902 *did_curwin = TRUE1;
1903 return TRUE1;
1904}
1905
1906/*
1907 * If needed, add the current lines of the terminal to scrollback and to the
1908 * buffer. Called after the job has ended and when switching to
1909 * Terminal-Normal mode.
1910 * When "redraw" is TRUE redraw the windows that show the terminal.
1911 */
1912 static void
1913may_move_terminal_to_buffer(term_T *term, int redraw)
1914{
1915 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
1916 return;
1917
1918 // Update the snapshot only if something changes or the buffer does not
1919 // have all the lines.
1920 if (term->tl_dirty_snapshot || term->tl_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count
1921 <= term->tl_scrollback_scrolled)
1922 update_snapshot(term);
1923
1924 // Obtain the current background color.
1925 vterm_state_get_default_colors(vterm_obtain_state(term->tl_vterm),
1926 &term->tl_default_color.fg, &term->tl_default_color.bg);
1927
1928 if (redraw)
1929 {
1930 win_T *wp = NULL((void*)0);
1931 int did_curwin = FALSE0;
1932
1933 while (for_all_windows_and_curwin(&wp, &did_curwin))
1934 {
1935 if (wp->w_buffer == term->tl_buffer)
1936 {
1937 wp->w_cursor.lnum = term->tl_buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
1938 wp->w_cursor.col = 0;
1939 wp->w_valid = 0;
1940 if (wp->w_cursor.lnum >= wp->w_height)
1941 {
1942 linenr_T min_topline = wp->w_cursor.lnum - wp->w_height + 1;
1943
1944 if (wp->w_topline < min_topline)
1945 wp->w_topline = min_topline;
1946 }
1947 redraw_win_later(wp, NOT_VALID40);
1948 }
1949 }
1950 }
1951}
1952
1953#if defined(FEAT_TIMERS) || defined(PROTO)
1954/*
1955 * Check if any terminal timer expired. If so, copy text from the terminal to
1956 * the buffer.
1957 * Return the time until the next timer will expire.
1958 */
1959 int
1960term_check_timers(int next_due_arg, proftime_T *now)
1961{
1962 term_T *term;
1963 int next_due = next_due_arg;
1964
1965 FOR_ALL_TERMS(term)for ((term) = first_term; (term) != ((void*)0); (term) = (term
)->tl_next)
1966 {
1967 if (term->tl_timer_set && !term->tl_normal_mode)
1968 {
1969 long this_due = proftime_time_left(&term->tl_timer_due, now);
1970
1971 if (this_due <= 1)
1972 {
1973 term->tl_timer_set = FALSE0;
1974 may_move_terminal_to_buffer(term, FALSE0);
1975 }
1976 else if (next_due == -1 || next_due > this_due)
1977 next_due = this_due;
1978 }
1979 }
1980
1981 return next_due;
1982}
1983#endif
1984
1985/*
1986 * When "normal_mode" is TRUE set the terminal to Terminal-Normal mode,
1987 * otherwise end it.
1988 */
1989 static void
1990set_terminal_mode(term_T *term, int normal_mode)
1991{
1992 term->tl_normal_mode = normal_mode;
1993 if (!normal_mode)
1994 handle_postponed_scrollback(term);
1995 VIM_CLEAR(term->tl_status_text)do { if ((term->tl_status_text) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(
term->tl_status_text); (term->tl_status_text) = ((void*
)0); } } while (0);
1996 if (term->tl_buffer == curbuf)
1997 maketitle();
1998}
1999
2000/*
2001 * Called after the job is finished and Terminal mode is not active:
2002 * Move the vterm contents into the scrollback buffer and free the vterm.
2003 */
2004 static void
2005cleanup_vterm(term_T *term)
2006{
2007 set_terminal_mode(term, FALSE0);
2008 if (term->tl_finish != TL_FINISH_CLOSE'c')
2009 may_move_terminal_to_buffer(term, TRUE1);
2010 term_free_vterm(term);
2011}
2012
2013/*
2014 * Switch from Terminal-Job mode to Terminal-Normal mode.
2015 * Suspends updating the terminal window.
2016 */
2017 static void
2018term_enter_normal_mode(void)
2019{
2020 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
2021
2022 set_terminal_mode(term, TRUE1);
2023
2024 // Append the current terminal contents to the buffer.
2025 may_move_terminal_to_buffer(term, TRUE1);
2026
2027 // Move the window cursor to the position of the cursor in the
2028 // terminal.
2029 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = term->tl_scrollback_scrolled
2030 + term->tl_cursor_pos.row + 1;
2031 check_cursor();
2032 if (coladvance(term->tl_cursor_pos.col) == FAIL0)
2033 coladvance(MAXCOL2147483647);
2034 curwin->w_set_curswant = TRUE1;
2035
2036 // Display the same lines as in the terminal.
2037 curwin->w_topline = term->tl_scrollback_scrolled + 1;
2038}
2039
2040/*
2041 * Returns TRUE if the current window contains a terminal and we are in
2042 * Terminal-Normal mode.
2043 */
2044 int
2045term_in_normal_mode(void)
2046{
2047 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
2048
2049 return term != NULL((void*)0) && term->tl_normal_mode;
2050}
2051
2052/*
2053 * Switch from Terminal-Normal mode to Terminal-Job mode.
2054 * Restores updating the terminal window.
2055 */
2056 void
2057term_enter_job_mode()
2058{
2059 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
2060
2061 set_terminal_mode(term, FALSE0);
2062
2063 if (term->tl_channel_closed)
2064 cleanup_vterm(term);
2065 redraw_buf_and_status_later(curbuf, NOT_VALID40);
2066#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
2067 if (WIN_IS_POPUP(curwin)((curwin)->w_popup_flags != 0))
2068 redraw_later(NOT_VALID40);
2069#endif
2070}

2072/*
2073 * Get a key from the user with terminal mode mappings.
2074 * Note: while waiting a terminal may be closed and freed if the channel is
2075 * closed and ++close was used.
2076 */
2077 static int
2078term_vgetc()
2079{
2080 int c;
2081 int save_State = State;
2082 int modify_other_keys =
2083 vterm_is_modify_other_keys(curbuf->b_term->tl_vterm);
2084
2085 State = TERMINAL0x2000;
2086 got_int = FALSE0;
2087#ifdef MSWIN
2088 ctrl_break_was_pressed = FALSE0;
2089#endif
2090 if (modify_other_keys)
2091 ++no_reduce_keys;
2092 c = vgetc();
2093 got_int = FALSE0;
2094 State = save_State;
2095 if (modify_other_keys)
2096 --no_reduce_keys;
2097 return c;
2098}
2099
2100static int mouse_was_outside = FALSE0;
2101
2102/*
2103 * Send key "c" with modifiers "modmask" to terminal.
2104 * Return FAIL when the key needs to be handled in Normal mode.
2105 * Return OK when the key was dropped or sent to the terminal.
2106 */
2107 int
2108send_keys_to_term(term_T *term, int c, int modmask, int typed)
2109{
2110 char msg[KEY_BUF_LEN200];
2111 size_t len;
2112 int dragging_outside = FALSE0;
2113
2114 // Catch keys that need to be handled as in Normal mode.
2115 switch (c)
2116 {
2117 case NUL'\000':
2118 case K_ZERO(-((255) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))):
2119 if (typed)
2120 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
2121 return FAIL0;
2122
2123 case K_TABLINE(-((240) + ((int)(('X')) << 8))):
2124 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
2125 return FAIL0;
2126
2127 case K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))):
2128 case K_CANCEL(-((253) + ((int)(KE_CANCEL) << 8))): // used for :normal when running out of chars
2129 return FAIL0;
2130
2131 case K_LEFTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTDRAG) << 8))):
2132 case K_MIDDLEDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEDRAG) << 8))):
2133 case K_RIGHTDRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTDRAG) << 8))):
2134 case K_X1DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1DRAG) << 8))):
2135 case K_X2DRAG(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2DRAG) << 8))):
2136 dragging_outside = mouse_was_outside;
2137 // FALLTHROUGH
2138 case K_LEFTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE) << 8))):
2139 case K_LEFTMOUSE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTMOUSE_NM) << 8))):
2140 case K_LEFTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE) << 8))):
2141 case K_LEFTRELEASE_NM(-((253) + ((int)(KE_LEFTRELEASE_NM) << 8))):
2142 case K_MOUSEMOVE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEMOVE) << 8))):
2143 case K_MIDDLEMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLEMOUSE) << 8))):
2144 case K_MIDDLERELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MIDDLERELEASE) << 8))):
2145 case K_RIGHTMOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTMOUSE) << 8))):
2146 case K_RIGHTRELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_RIGHTRELEASE) << 8))):
2147 case K_X1MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1MOUSE) << 8))):
2148 case K_X1RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X1RELEASE) << 8))):
2149 case K_X2MOUSE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2MOUSE) << 8))):
2150 case K_X2RELEASE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_X2RELEASE) << 8))):
2151
2152 case K_MOUSEUP(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEUP) << 8))):
2153 case K_MOUSEDOWN(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEDOWN) << 8))):
2154 case K_MOUSELEFT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSELEFT) << 8))):
2155 case K_MOUSERIGHT(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSERIGHT) << 8))):
2156 {
2157 int row = mouse_row;
2158 int col = mouse_col;
2159
2160#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
2161 if (popup_is_popup(curwin))
2162 {
2163 row -= popup_top_extra(curwin);
2164 col -= popup_left_extra(curwin);
2165 }
2166#endif
2167 if (row < W_WINROW(curwin)(curwin->w_winrow + curwin->w_winbar_height)
2168 || row >= (W_WINROW(curwin)(curwin->w_winrow + curwin->w_winbar_height) + curwin->w_height)
2169 || col < curwin->w_wincol
2170 || col >= W_ENDCOL(curwin)(curwin->w_wincol + curwin->w_width)
2171 || dragging_outside)
2172 {
2173 // click or scroll outside the current window or on status
2174 // line or vertical separator
2175 if (typed)
2176 {
2177 stuffcharReadbuff(c);
2178 mouse_was_outside = TRUE1;
2179 }
2180 return FAIL0;
2181 }
2182 }
2183 break;
2184
2185 case K_COMMAND(-((253) + ((int)(KE_COMMAND) << 8))):
2186 return do_cmdline(NULL((void*)0), getcmdkeycmd, NULL((void*)0), 0);
2187 }
2188 if (typed)
2189 mouse_was_outside = FALSE0;
2190
2191 // Convert the typed key to a sequence of bytes for the job.
2192 len = term_convert_key(term, c, modmask, msg);
2193 if (len > 0)
2194 // TODO: if FAIL is returned, stop?
2195 channel_send(term->tl_job->jv_channel, get_tty_part(term),
2196 (char_u *)msg, (int)len, NULL((void*)0));
2197
2198 return OK1;
2199}
2200
2201 static void
2202position_cursor(win_T *wp, VTermPos *pos, int add_off UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
2203{
2204 wp->w_wrow = MIN(pos->row, MAX(0, wp->w_height - 1))(((pos->row)<((((0)>(wp->w_height - 1))?(0):(wp->
w_height - 1))))?(pos->row):((((0)>(wp->w_height - 1
))?(0):(wp->w_height - 1))));
2205 wp->w_wcol = MIN(pos->col, MAX(0, wp->w_width - 1))(((pos->col)<((((0)>(wp->w_width - 1))?(0):(wp->
w_width - 1))))?(pos->col):((((0)>(wp->w_width - 1))
?(0):(wp->w_width - 1))));
2206#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
2207 if (add_off && popup_is_popup(curwin))
2208 {
2209 wp->w_wrow += popup_top_extra(curwin);
2210 wp->w_wcol += popup_left_extra(curwin);
2211 wp->w_flags |= WFLAG_WCOL_OFF_ADDED1 | WFLAG_WROW_OFF_ADDED2;
2212 }
2213 else
2214 wp->w_flags &= ~(WFLAG_WCOL_OFF_ADDED1 | WFLAG_WROW_OFF_ADDED2);
2215#endif
2216 wp->w_valid |= (VALID_WCOL0x02|VALID_WROW0x01);
2217}
2218
2219/*
2220 * Handle CTRL-W "": send register contents to the job.
2221 */
2222 static void
2223term_paste_register(int prev_c UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
2224{
2225 int c;
2226 list_T *l;
2227 listitem_T *item;
2228 long reglen = 0;
2229 int type;
2230
2231#ifdef FEAT_CMDL_INFO
2232 if (add_to_showcmd(prev_c))
2233 if (add_to_showcmd('"'))
2234 out_flush();
2235#endif
2236 c = term_vgetc();
2237#ifdef FEAT_CMDL_INFO
2238 clear_showcmd();
2239#endif
2240 if (!term_use_loop())
2241 // job finished while waiting for a character
2242 return;
2243
2244 // CTRL-W "= prompt for expression to evaluate.
2245 if (c == '=' && get_expr_register() != '=')
2246 return;
2247 if (!term_use_loop())
2248 // job finished while waiting for a character
2249 return;
2250
2251 l = (list_T *)get_reg_contents(c, GREG_LIST4);
2252 if (l != NULL((void*)0))
2253 {
2254 type = get_reg_type(c, &reglen);
2255 FOR_ALL_LIST_ITEMS(l, item)for ((item) = (l)->lv_first; (item) != ((void*)0); (item) =
(item)->li_next)
2256 {
2257 char_u *s = tv_get_string(&item->li_tv);
2258#ifdef MSWIN
2259 char_u *tmp = s;
2260
2261 if (!enc_utf8 && enc_codepage > 0)
2262 {
2263 WCHAR *ret = NULL((void*)0);
2264 int length = 0;
2265
2266 MultiByteToWideChar_alloc(enc_codepage, 0, (char *)s,
2267 (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)), &ret, &length);
2268 if (ret != NULL((void*)0))
2269 {
2270 WideCharToMultiByte_alloc(CP_UTF8, 0,
2271 ret, length, (char **)&s, &length, 0, 0);
2272 vim_free(ret);
2273 }
2274 }
2275#endif
2276 channel_send(curbuf->b_term->tl_job->jv_channel, PART_IN,
2277 s, (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)), NULL((void*)0));
2278#ifdef MSWIN
2279 if (tmp != s)
2280 vim_free(s);
2281#endif
2282
2283 if (item->li_next != NULL((void*)0) || type == MLINE1)
2284 channel_send(curbuf->b_term->tl_job->jv_channel, PART_IN,
2285 (char_u *)"\r", 1, NULL((void*)0));
2286 }
2287 list_free(l);
2288 }
2289}
2290
2291/*
2292 * Return TRUE when waiting for a character in the terminal, the cursor of the
2293 * terminal should be displayed.
2294 */
2295 int
2296terminal_is_active()
2297{
2298 return in_terminal_loop != NULL((void*)0);
2299}

2305term_get_highlight_name(term_T *term)

2312#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(PROTO)
2313 cursorentry_T *
2314term_get_cursor_shape(guicolor_Tlong *fg, guicolor_Tlong *bg)
2315{
2316 term_T *term = in_terminal_loop;
2317 static cursorentry_T entry;
2318 int id;
2319 guicolor_Tlong term_fg, term_bg;
2320
2321 CLEAR_FIELD(entry)memset((&(entry)), (0), (sizeof(entry)));
2322 entry.shape = entry.mshape =
2323 term->tl_cursor_shape == VTERM_PROP_CURSORSHAPE_UNDERLINE ? SHAPE_HOR1 :
2324 term->tl_cursor_shape == VTERM_PROP_CURSORSHAPE_BAR_LEFT ? SHAPE_VER2 :
2325 SHAPE_BLOCK0;
2326 entry.percentage = 20;
2327 if (term->tl_cursor_blink)
2328 {
2329 entry.blinkwait = 700;
2330 entry.blinkon = 400;
2331 entry.blinkoff = 250;
2332 }
2333
2334 // The highlight group overrules the defaults.
2335 id = syn_name2id(term_get_highlight_name(term));
2336 if (id != 0)
2337 {
2338 syn_id2colors(id, &term_fg, &term_bg);
2339 *fg = term_bg;
2340 }
2341 else
2342 *fg = gui.back_pixel;
2343
2344 if (term->tl_cursor_color == NULL((void*)0))
2345 {
2346 if (id != 0)
2347 *bg = term_fg;
2348 else
2349 *bg = gui.norm_pixel;
2350 }
2351 else
2352 *bg = color_name2handle(term->tl_cursor_color);
2353 entry.name = "n";
2354 entry.used_for = SHAPE_CURSOR2;
2355
2356 return &entry;
2357}
2358#endif
2359
2360 static void
2361may_output_cursor_props(void)
2362{
2363 if (!cursor_color_equal(last_set_cursor_color, desired_cursor_color)
2364 || last_set_cursor_shape != desired_cursor_shape
2365 || last_set_cursor_blink != desired_cursor_blink)
2366 {
2367 cursor_color_copy(&last_set_cursor_color, desired_cursor_color);
2368 last_set_cursor_shape = desired_cursor_shape;
2369 last_set_cursor_blink = desired_cursor_blink;
2370 term_cursor_color(cursor_color_get(desired_cursor_color));
2371 if (desired_cursor_shape == -1 || desired_cursor_blink == -1)
2372 // this will restore the initial cursor style, if possible
2373 ui_cursor_shape_forced(TRUE1);
2374 else
2375 term_cursor_shape(desired_cursor_shape, desired_cursor_blink);
2376 }
2377}
2378
2379/*
2380 * Set the cursor color and shape, if not last set to these.
2381 */
2382 static void
2383may_set_cursor_props(term_T *term)
2384{
2385#ifdef FEAT_GUI
2386 // For the GUI the cursor properties are obtained with
2387 // term_get_cursor_shape().
2388 if (gui.in_use)
2389 return;
2390#endif
2391 if (in_terminal_loop == term)
2392 {
2393 cursor_color_copy(&desired_cursor_color, term->tl_cursor_color);
2394 desired_cursor_shape = term->tl_cursor_shape;
2395 desired_cursor_blink = term->tl_cursor_blink;
2396 may_output_cursor_props();
2397 }
2398}
2399
2400/*
2401 * Reset the desired cursor properties and restore them when needed.
2402 */
2403 static void
2404prepare_restore_cursor_props(void)
2405{
2406#ifdef FEAT_GUI
2407 if (gui.in_use)
2408 return;
2409#endif
2410 cursor_color_copy(&desired_cursor_color, NULL((void*)0));
2411 desired_cursor_shape = -1;
2412 desired_cursor_blink = -1;
2413 may_output_cursor_props();
2414}

2416/*
2417 * Returns TRUE if the current window contains a terminal and we are sending
2418 * keys to the job.
2419 * If "check_job_status" is TRUE update the job status.
2420 */
2421 static int
2422term_use_loop_check(int check_job_status)
2423{
2424 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
2425
2426 return term != NULL((void*)0)
2427 && !term->tl_normal_mode
2428 && term->tl_vterm != NULL((void*)0)
2429 && term_job_running_check(term, check_job_status);
2430}

2432/*
2433 * Returns TRUE if the current window contains a terminal and we are sending
2434 * keys to the job.
2435 */
2436 int
2437term_use_loop(void)
2438{
2439 return term_use_loop_check(FALSE0);
2440}

2443 * Called when entering a window with the mouse. If this is a terminal window
2444 * we may want to change state.

2447term_win_entered()

2454 {
2455 reset_VIsual_and_resel();
2456 if (State & INSERT0x10)
2457 stop_insert_mode = TRUE1;

2459 mouse_was_outside = FALSE0;
2460 enter_mouse_col = mouse_col;
2461 enter_mouse_row = mouse_row;

2464
2465/*
2466 * vgetc() may not include CTRL in the key when modify_other_keys is set.
2467 * Return the Ctrl-key value in that case.
2468 */
2469 static int
2470raw_c_to_ctrl(int c)
2471{
2472 if ((mod_mask & MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04)
2473 && ((c >= '`' && c <= 0x7f) || (c >= '@' && c <= '_')))
2474 return c & 0x1f;
2475 return c;
2476}
2477
2478/*
2479 * When modify_other_keys is set then do the reverse of raw_c_to_ctrl().
2480 * May set "mod_mask".
2481 */
2482 static int
2483ctrl_to_raw_c(int c)
2484{
2485 if (c < 0x20 && vterm_is_modify_other_keys(curbuf->b_term->tl_vterm))
2486 {
2487 mod_mask |= MOD_MASK_CTRL0x04;
2488 return c + '@';
2489 }
2490 return c;
2491}
2492
2493/*
2494 * Wait for input and send it to the job.
2495 * When "blocking" is TRUE wait for a character to be typed. Otherwise return
2496 * when there is no more typahead.
2497 * Return when the start of a CTRL-W command is typed or anything else that
2498 * should be handled as a Normal mode command.
2499 * Returns OK if a typed character is to be handled in Normal mode, FAIL if
2500 * the terminal was closed.
2501 */
2502 int
2503terminal_loop(int blocking)
2504{
2505 int c;
2506 int raw_c;
2507 int termwinkey = 0;
2508 int ret;
2509#ifdef UNIX1
2510 int tty_fd = curbuf->b_term->tl_job->jv_channel
2511 ->ch_part[get_tty_part(curbuf->b_term)].ch_fd;
2512#endif
2513 int restore_cursor = FALSE0;
2514
2515 // Remember the terminal we are sending keys to. However, the terminal
2516 // might be closed while waiting for a character, e.g. typing "exit" in a
2517 // shell and ++close was used. Therefore use curbuf->b_term instead of a
2518 // stored reference.
2519 in_terminal_loop = curbuf->b_term;
2520
2521 if (*curwin->w_p_twkw_onebuf_opt.wo_twk != NUL'\000')
2522 {
2523 termwinkey = string_to_key(curwin->w_p_twkw_onebuf_opt.wo_twk, TRUE1);
2524 if (termwinkey == Ctrl_W23)
2525 termwinkey = 0;
2526 }
2527 position_cursor(curwin, &curbuf->b_term->tl_cursor_pos, TRUE1);
2528 may_set_cursor_props(curbuf->b_term);
2529
2530 while (blocking || vpeekc_nomap() != NUL'\000')
2531 {
2532#ifdef FEAT_GUI
2533 if (curbuf->b_term != NULL((void*)0) && !curbuf->b_term->tl_system)
2534#endif
2535 // TODO: skip screen update when handling a sequence of keys.
2536 // Repeat redrawing in case a message is received while redrawing.
2537 while (must_redraw != 0)
2538 if (update_screen(0) == FAIL0)
2539 break;
2540 if (!term_use_loop_check(TRUE1) || in_terminal_loop != curbuf->b_term)
2541 // job finished while redrawing
2542 break;
2543
2544 update_cursor(curbuf->b_term, FALSE0);
2545 restore_cursor = TRUE1;
2546
2547 raw_c = term_vgetc();
2548 if (!term_use_loop_check(TRUE1) || in_terminal_loop != curbuf->b_term)
2549 {
2550 // Job finished while waiting for a character. Push back the
2551 // received character.
2552 if (raw_c != K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))))
2553 vungetc(raw_c);
2554 break;
2555 }
2556 if (raw_c == K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))))
2557 continue;
2558 c = raw_c_to_ctrl(raw_c);
2559
2560#ifdef UNIX1
2561 /*
2562 * The shell or another program may change the tty settings. Getting
2563 * them for every typed character is a bit of overhead, but it's needed
2564 * for the first character typed, e.g. when Vim starts in a shell.
2565 */
2566 if (mch_isatty(tty_fd))
2567 {
2568 ttyinfo_T info;
2569
2570 // Get the current backspace character of the pty.
2571 if (get_tty_info(tty_fd, &info) == OK1)
2572 term_backspace_char = info.backspace;
2573 }
2574#endif
2575
2576#ifdef MSWIN
2577 // On Windows winpty handles CTRL-C, don't send a CTRL_C_EVENT.
2578 // Use CTRL-BREAK to kill the job.
2579 if (ctrl_break_was_pressed)
2580 mch_signal_job(curbuf->b_term->tl_job, (char_u *)"kill");
2581#endif
2582 // Was either CTRL-W (termwinkey) or CTRL-\ pressed?
2583 // Not in a system terminal.
2584 if ((c == (termwinkey == 0 ? Ctrl_W23 : termwinkey) || c == Ctrl_BSL28)
2585#ifdef FEAT_GUI
2586 && !curbuf->b_term->tl_system
2587#endif
2588 )
2589 {
2590 int prev_c = c;
2591 int prev_raw_c = raw_c;
2592 int prev_mod_mask = mod_mask;
2593
2594#ifdef FEAT_CMDL_INFO
2595 if (add_to_showcmd(c))
2596 out_flush();
2597#endif
2598 raw_c = term_vgetc();
2599 c = raw_c_to_ctrl(raw_c);
2600
2601#ifdef FEAT_CMDL_INFO
2602 clear_showcmd();
2603#endif
2604 if (!term_use_loop_check(TRUE1)
2605 || in_terminal_loop != curbuf->b_term)
2606 // job finished while waiting for a character
2607 break;
2608
2609 if (prev_c == Ctrl_BSL28)
2610 {
2611 if (c == Ctrl_N14)
2612 {
2613 // CTRL-\ CTRL-N : go to Terminal-Normal mode.
2614 term_enter_normal_mode();
2615 ret = FAIL0;
2616 goto theend;
2617 }
2618 // Send both keys to the terminal, first one here, second one
2619 // below.
2620 send_keys_to_term(curbuf->b_term, prev_raw_c, prev_mod_mask,
2621 TRUE1);
2622 }
2623 else if (c == Ctrl_C3)
2624 {
2625 // "CTRL-W CTRL-C" or 'termwinkey' CTRL-C: end the job
2626 mch_signal_job(curbuf->b_term->tl_job, (char_u *)"kill");
2627 }
2628 else if (c == '.')
2629 {
2630 // "CTRL-W .": send CTRL-W to the job
2631 // "'termwinkey' .": send 'termwinkey' to the job
2632 raw_c = ctrl_to_raw_c(termwinkey == 0 ? Ctrl_W23 : termwinkey);
2633 }
2634 else if (c == Ctrl_BSL28)
2635 {
2636 // "CTRL-W CTRL-\": send CTRL-\ to the job
2637 raw_c = ctrl_to_raw_c(Ctrl_BSL28);
2638 }
2639 else if (c == 'N')
2640 {
2641 // CTRL-W N : go to Terminal-Normal mode.
2642 term_enter_normal_mode();
2643 ret = FAIL0;
2644 goto theend;
2645 }
2646 else if (c == '"')
2647 {
2648 term_paste_register(prev_c);
2649 continue;
2650 }
2651 else if (termwinkey == 0 || c != termwinkey)
2652 {
2653 // space for CTRL-W, modifier, multi-byte char and NUL
2654 char_u buf[1 + 3 + MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
2655
2656 // Put the command into the typeahead buffer, when using the
2657 // stuff buffer KeyStuffed is set and 'langmap' won't be used.
2658 buf[0] = Ctrl_W23;
2659 buf[special_to_buf(c, mod_mask, FALSE0, buf + 1) + 1] = NUL'\000';
2660 ins_typebuf(buf, REMAP_NONE-1, 0, TRUE1, FALSE0);
2661 ret = OK1;
2662 goto theend;
2663 }
2664 }
2665# ifdef MSWIN
2666 if (!enc_utf8 && has_mbyte && raw_c >= 0x80)
2667 {
2668 WCHAR wc;
2669 char_u mb[3];
2670
2671 mb[0] = (unsigned)raw_c >> 8;
2672 mb[1] = raw_c;
2673 if (MultiByteToWideChar(GetACP(), 0, (char*)mb, 2, &wc, 1) > 0)
2674 raw_c = wc;
2675 }
2676# endif
2677 if (send_keys_to_term(curbuf->b_term, raw_c, mod_mask, TRUE1) != OK1)
2678 {
2679 if (raw_c == K_MOUSEMOVE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_MOUSEMOVE) << 8))))
2680 // We are sure to come back here, don't reset the cursor color
2681 // and shape to avoid flickering.
2682 restore_cursor = FALSE0;
2683
2684 ret = OK1;
2685 goto theend;
2686 }
2687 }
2688 ret = FAIL0;
2689
2690theend:
2691 in_terminal_loop = NULL((void*)0);
2692 if (restore_cursor)
2693 prepare_restore_cursor_props();
2694
2695 // Move a snapshot of the screen contents to the buffer, so that completion
2696 // works in other buffers.
2697 if (curbuf->b_term != NULL((void*)0) && !curbuf->b_term->tl_normal_mode)
2698 may_move_terminal_to_buffer(curbuf->b_term, FALSE0);
2699
2700 return ret;
2701}
2702
2703 static void
2704may_toggle_cursor(term_T *term)
2705{
2706 if (in_terminal_loop == term)
2707 {
2708 if (term->tl_cursor_visible)
2709 cursor_on();
2710 else
2711 cursor_off();
2712 }
2713}
