2747 int fg = -1;
2748 int bg = -1;
2749
2750 if (id > 0)
2751 syn_id2cterm_bg(id, &fg, &bg);
2752 return bg;
2753 }
2754 return term_default_cterm_bg;
2755}
2756
2757/*
2758 * Reverse engineer the RGB value into a cterm color index.
2759 * First color is 1. Return 0 if no match found (default color).
2760 */
2761 static int
2762color2index(VTermColor *color, int fg, int *boldp)
2763{
2764 int red = color->red;
2765 int blue = color->blue;
2766 int green = color->green;
2767
2768 if (VTERM_COLOR_IS_DEFAULT_FG(color)(!!((color)->type & VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_FG))
2769 || VTERM_COLOR_IS_DEFAULT_BG(color)(!!((color)->type & VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_BG)))
2770 return 0;
2771 if (VTERM_COLOR_IS_INDEXED(color)(((color)->type & VTERM_COLOR_TYPE_MASK) == VTERM_COLOR_INDEXED
))
2772 {
2773 // The first 16 colors and default: use the ANSI index.
2774 switch (color->index + 1)
2775 {
2776 case 0: return 0;
2777 case 1: return lookup_color( 0, fg, boldp) + 1; // black
2778 case 2: return lookup_color( 4, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark red
2779 case 3: return lookup_color( 2, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark green
2780 case 4: return lookup_color( 7, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark yellow
2781 case 5: return lookup_color( 1, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark blue
2782 case 6: return lookup_color( 5, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark magenta
2783 case 7: return lookup_color( 3, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark cyan
2784 case 8: return lookup_color( 8, fg, boldp) + 1; // light grey
2785 case 9: return lookup_color(12, fg, boldp) + 1; // dark grey
2786 case 10: return lookup_color(20, fg, boldp) + 1; // red
2787 case 11: return lookup_color(16, fg, boldp) + 1; // green
2788 case 12: return lookup_color(24, fg, boldp) + 1; // yellow
2789 case 13: return lookup_color(14, fg, boldp) + 1; // blue
2790 case 14: return lookup_color(22, fg, boldp) + 1; // magenta
2791 case 15: return lookup_color(18, fg, boldp) + 1; // cyan
2792 case 16: return lookup_color(26, fg, boldp) + 1; // white
2793 }
2794 }
2795
2796 if (t_colors >= 256)
2797 {
2798 if (red == blue && red == green)
2799 {
2800 // 24-color greyscale plus white and black
2801 static int cutoff[23] = {
2802 0x0D, 0x17, 0x21, 0x2B, 0x35, 0x3F, 0x49, 0x53, 0x5D, 0x67,
2803 0x71, 0x7B, 0x85, 0x8F, 0x99, 0xA3, 0xAD, 0xB7, 0xC1, 0xCB,
2804 0xD5, 0xDF, 0xE9};
2805 int i;
2806
2807 if (red < 5)
2808 return 17; // 00/00/00
2809 if (red > 245) // ff/ff/ff
2810 return 232;
2811 for (i = 0; i < 23; ++i)
2812 if (red < cutoff[i])
2813 return i + 233;
2814 return 256;
2815 }
2816 {
2817 static int cutoff[5] = {0x2F, 0x73, 0x9B, 0xC3, 0xEB};
2818 int ri, gi, bi;
2819
2820 // 216-color cube
2821 for (ri = 0; ri < 5; ++ri)
2822 if (red < cutoff[ri])
2823 break;
2824 for (gi = 0; gi < 5; ++gi)
2825 if (green < cutoff[gi])
2826 break;
2827 for (bi = 0; bi < 5; ++bi)
2828 if (blue < cutoff[bi])
2829 break;
2830 return 17 + ri * 36 + gi * 6 + bi;
2831 }
2832 }
2833 return 0;
2834}
2835
2836/*
2837 * Convert Vterm attributes to highlight flags.
2838 */
2839 static int
2840vtermAttr2hl(VTermScreenCellAttrs cellattrs)
2841{
2842 int attr = 0;
2843
2844 if (cellattrs.bold)
2845 attr |= HL_BOLD0x02;
2846 if (cellattrs.underline)
2847 attr |= HL_UNDERLINE0x08;
2848 if (cellattrs.italic)
2849 attr |= HL_ITALIC0x04;
2850 if (cellattrs.strike)
2851 attr |= HL_STRIKETHROUGH0x80;
2852 if (cellattrs.reverse)
2853 attr |= HL_INVERSE0x01;
2854 return attr;
2855}
2856
2857/*
2858 * Store Vterm attributes in "cell" from highlight flags.
2859 */
2860 static void
2861hl2vtermAttr(int attr, cellattr_T *cell)
2862{
2863 CLEAR_FIELD(cell->attrs)memset((&(cell->attrs)), (0), (sizeof(cell->attrs))
);
2864 if (attr & HL_BOLD0x02)
2865 cell->attrs.bold = 1;
2866 if (attr & HL_UNDERLINE0x08)
2867 cell->attrs.underline = 1;
2868 if (attr & HL_ITALIC0x04)
2869 cell->attrs.italic = 1;
2870 if (attr & HL_STRIKETHROUGH0x80)
2871 cell->attrs.strike = 1;
2872 if (attr & HL_INVERSE0x01)
2873 cell->attrs.reverse = 1;
2874}
2875
2876/*
2877 * Convert the attributes of a vterm cell into an attribute index.
2878 */
2879 static int
2880cell2attr(
2881 term_T *term,
2882 win_T *wp,
2883 VTermScreenCellAttrs cellattrs,
2884 VTermColor cellfg,
2885 VTermColor cellbg)
2886{
2887 int attr = vtermAttr2hl(cellattrs);
2888
2889#ifdef FEAT_GUI
2890 if (gui.in_use)
2891 {
2892 guicolor_Tlong fg, bg;
2893
2894 fg = gui_mch_get_rgb_color(cellfg.red, cellfg.green, cellfg.blue);
2895 bg = gui_mch_get_rgb_color(cellbg.red, cellbg.green, cellbg.blue);
2896 return get_gui_attr_idx(attr, fg, bg);
2897 }
2898 else
2899#endif
2900#ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
2901 if (p_tgc)
2902 {
2903 guicolor_Tlong fg, bg;
2904
2905 fg = gui_get_rgb_color_cmn(cellfg.red, cellfg.green, cellfg.blue);
2906 bg = gui_get_rgb_color_cmn(cellbg.red, cellbg.green, cellbg.blue);
2907
2908 return get_tgc_attr_idx(attr, fg, bg);
2909 }
2910 else
2911#endif
2912 {
2913 int bold = MAYBE2;
2914 int fg = color2index(&cellfg, TRUE1, &bold);
2915 int bg = color2index(&cellbg, FALSE0, &bold);
2916
2917 // Use the 'wincolor' or "Terminal" highlighting for the default
2918 // colors.
2919 if ((fg == 0 || bg == 0) && t_colors >= 16)
2920 {
2921 int wincolor_fg = -1;
2922 int wincolor_bg = -1;
2923
2924 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && *wp->w_p_wcrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wcr != NUL'\000')
2925 {
2926 int id = syn_name2id(curwin->w_p_wcrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wcr);
2927
2928 // Get the 'wincolor' group colors.
2929 if (id > 0)
2930 syn_id2cterm_bg(id, &wincolor_fg, &wincolor_bg);
2931 }
2932 if (fg == 0)
2933 {
2934 if (wincolor_fg >= 0)
2935 fg = wincolor_fg + 1;
2936 else
2937 {
2938 int cterm_fg = get_default_cterm_fg(term);
2939
2940 if (cterm_fg >= 0)
2941 fg = cterm_fg + 1;
2942 }
2943 }
2944 if (bg == 0)
2945 {
2946 if (wincolor_bg >= 0)
2947 bg = wincolor_bg + 1;
2948 else
2949 {
2950 int cterm_bg = get_default_cterm_bg(term);
2951
2952 if (cterm_bg >= 0)
2953 bg = cterm_bg + 1;
2954 }
2955 }
2956 }
2957
2958 // with 8 colors set the bold attribute to get a bright foreground
2959 if (bold == TRUE1)
2960 attr |= HL_BOLD0x02;
2961 return get_cterm_attr_idx(attr, fg, bg);
2962 }
2963 return 0;
2964}

2999 int clear_attr;

3016 static int
3017handle_moverect(VTermRect dest, VTermRect src, void *user)
3018{
3019 term_T *term = (term_T *)user;
3020 int count = src.start_row - dest.start_row;
3021
3022 // Scrolling up is done much more efficiently by deleting lines instead of
3023 // redrawing the text. But avoid doing this multiple times, postpone until
3024 // the redraw happens.
3025 if (dest.start_col == src.start_col
3026 && dest.end_col == src.end_col
3027 && dest.start_row < src.start_row)
3028 {
3029 if (dest.start_row == 0)
3030 term->tl_postponed_scroll += count;
3031 else
3032 term_scroll_up(term, dest.start_row, count);
3033 }
3034
3035 term->tl_dirty_row_start = MIN(term->tl_dirty_row_start, dest.start_row)(((term->tl_dirty_row_start)<(dest.start_row))?(term->
tl_dirty_row_start):(dest.start_row));
3036 term->tl_dirty_row_end = MIN(term->tl_dirty_row_end, dest.end_row)(((term->tl_dirty_row_end)<(dest.end_row))?(term->tl_dirty_row_end
):(dest.end_row));
3037 set_dirty_snapshot(term);
3038
3039 // Note sure if the scrolling will work correctly, let's do a complete
3040 // redraw later.
3041 redraw_buf_later(term->tl_buffer, NOT_VALID40);
3042 return 1;
3043}

3100 else if (STRNCMP(" - ", strval, 4)strncmp((char *)(" - "), (char *)(strval), (size_t)(4)) == 0)
3101 term->tl_title = NULL((void*)0);
3102#ifdef MSWIN

3110 (int)value->string.len, &ret, &length);

3112 {

3114 ret, length, (char**)&term->tl_title,

3116 vim_free(ret);

3125 VIM_CLEAR(term->tl_status_text)do { if ((term->tl_status_text) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(
term->tl_status_text); (term->tl_status_text) = ((void*
)0); } } while (0);
3126 if (term == curbuf->b_term)

3134 break;
3135
3136 case VTERM_PROP_CURSORBLINK:

3198/*
3199 * If the number of lines that are stored goes over 'termscrollback' then
3200 * delete the first 10%.
3201 * "gap" points to tl_scrollback or tl_scrollback_postponed.
3202 * "update_buffer" is TRUE when the buffer should be updated.
3203 */
3204 static void
3205limit_scrollback(term_T *term, garray_T *gap, int update_buffer)
3206{
3207 if (gap->ga_len >= term->tl_buffer->b_p_twsl)
3208 {
3209 int todo = term->tl_buffer->b_p_twsl / 10;
3210 int i;
3211
3212 curbuf = term->tl_buffer;
3213 for (i = 0; i < todo; ++i)
3214 {
3215 vim_free(((sb_line_T *)gap->ga_data + i)->sb_cells);
3216 if (update_buffer)
3217 ml_delete(1);
3218 }
3219 curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
3220
3221 gap->ga_len -= todo;
3222 mch_memmove(gap->ga_data,memmove((char *)(gap->ga_data), (char *)((sb_line_T *)gap->
ga_data + todo), sizeof(sb_line_T) * gap->ga_len)
3223 (sb_line_T *)gap->ga_data + todo,memmove((char *)(gap->ga_data), (char *)((sb_line_T *)gap->
ga_data + todo), sizeof(sb_line_T) * gap->ga_len)
3224 sizeof(sb_line_T) * gap->ga_len)memmove((char *)(gap->ga_data), (char *)((sb_line_T *)gap->
ga_data + todo), sizeof(sb_line_T) * gap->ga_len);
3225 if (update_buffer)
3226 term->tl_scrollback_scrolled -= todo;
3227 }
3228}

3230/*
3231 * Handle a line that is pushed off the top of the screen.
3232 */
3233 static int
3234handle_pushline(int cols, const VTermScreenCell *cells, void *user)
3235{
3236 term_T *term = (term_T *)user;
3237 garray_T *gap;
3238 int update_buffer;
3239
3240 if (term->tl_normal_mode)
3241 {
3242 // In Terminal-Normal mode the user interacts with the buffer, thus we
3243 // must not change it. Postpone adding the scrollback lines.
3244 gap = &term->tl_scrollback_postponed;
3245 update_buffer = FALSE0;
3246 }
3247 else
3248 {
3249 // First remove the lines that were appended before, the pushed line
3250 // goes above it.
3251 cleanup_scrollback(term);
3252 gap = &term->tl_scrollback;
3253 update_buffer = TRUE1;
3254 }
3255
3256 limit_scrollback(term, gap, update_buffer);
3257
3258 if (ga_grow(gap, 1) == OK1)
3259 {
3260 cellattr_T *p = NULL((void*)0);
3261 int len = 0;
3262 int i;
3263 int c;
3264 int col;
3265 int text_len;
3266 char_u *text;
3267 sb_line_T *line;
3268 garray_T ga;
3269 cellattr_T fill_attr = term->tl_default_color;
3270
3271 // do not store empty cells at the end
3272 for (i = 0; i < cols; ++i)
3273 if (cells[i].chars[0] != 0)
3274 len = i + 1;
3275 else
3276 cell2cellattr(&cells[i], &fill_attr);
3277
3278 ga_init2(&ga, 1, 100);
3279 if (len > 0)
3280 p = ALLOC_MULT(cellattr_T, len)(cellattr_T *)alloc(sizeof(cellattr_T) * (len));
3281 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
3282 {
3283 for (col = 0; col < len; col += cells[col].width)
3284 {
3285 if (ga_grow(&ga, MB_MAXBYTES21) == FAIL0)
3286 {
3287 ga.ga_len = 0;
3288 break;
3289 }
3290 for (i = 0; (c = cells[col].chars[i]) > 0 || i == 0; ++i)
3291 ga.ga_len += utf_char2bytes(c == NUL'\000' ? ' ' : c,
3292 (char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len);
3293 cell2cellattr(&cells[col], &p[col]);
3294 }
3295 }
3296 if (ga_grow(&ga, 1) == FAIL0)
3297 {
3298 if (update_buffer)
3299 text = (char_u *)"";
3300 else
3301 text = vim_strsave((char_u *)"");
3302 text_len = 0;
3303 }
3304 else
3305 {
3306 text = ga.ga_data;
3307 text_len = ga.ga_len;
3308 *(text + text_len) = NUL'\000';
3309 }
3310 if (update_buffer)
3311 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, text, text_len);
3312
3313 line = (sb_line_T *)gap->ga_data + gap->ga_len;
3314 line->sb_cols = len;
3315 line->sb_cells = p;
3316 line->sb_fill_attr = fill_attr;
3317 if (update_buffer)
3318 {
3319 line->sb_text = NULL((void*)0);
3320 ++term->tl_scrollback_scrolled;
3321 ga_clear(&ga); // free the text
3322 }
3323 else
3324 {
3325 line->sb_text = text;
3326 ga_init(&ga); // text is kept in tl_scrollback_postponed
3327 }
3328 ++gap->ga_len;
3329 }
3330 return 0; // ignored
3331}
3332
3333/*
3334 * Called when leaving Terminal-Normal mode: deal with any scrollback that was
3335 * received and stored in tl_scrollback_postponed.
3336 */
3337 static void
3338handle_postponed_scrollback(term_T *term)
3339{
3340 int i;
3341
3342 if (term->tl_scrollback_postponed.ga_len == 0)
3343 return;
3344 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "Moving postponed scrollback to scrollback");
3345
3346 // First remove the lines that were appended before, the pushed lines go
3347 // above it.
3348 cleanup_scrollback(term);
3349
3350 for (i = 0; i < term->tl_scrollback_postponed.ga_len; ++i)
3351 {
3352 char_u *text;
3353 sb_line_T *pp_line;
3354 sb_line_T *line;
3355
3356 if (ga_grow(&term->tl_scrollback, 1) == FAIL0)
3357 break;
3358 pp_line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback_postponed.ga_data + i;
3359
3360 text = pp_line->sb_text;
3361 if (text == NULL((void*)0))
3362 text = (char_u *)"";
3363 add_scrollback_line_to_buffer(term, text, (int)STRLEN(text)strlen((char *)(text)));
3364 vim_free(pp_line->sb_text);
3365
3366 line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data
3367 + term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
3368 line->sb_cols = pp_line->sb_cols;
3369 line->sb_cells = pp_line->sb_cells;
3370 line->sb_fill_attr = pp_line->sb_fill_attr;
3371 line->sb_text = NULL((void*)0);
3372 ++term->tl_scrollback_scrolled;
3373 ++term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
3374 }
3375
3376 ga_clear(&term->tl_scrollback_postponed);
3377 limit_scrollback(term, &term->tl_scrollback, TRUE1);
3378}

3391/*
3392 * Do the work after the channel of a terminal was closed.
3393 * Must be called only when updating_screen is FALSE.
3394 * Returns TRUE when a buffer was closed (list of terminals may have changed).
3395 */
3396 static int
3397term_after_channel_closed(term_T *term)
3398{
3399 // Unless in Terminal-Normal mode: clear the vterm.
3400 if (!term->tl_normal_mode)
3401 {
3402 int fnum = term->tl_buffer->b_fnum;
3403
3404 cleanup_vterm(term);
3405
3406 if (term->tl_finish == TL_FINISH_CLOSE'c')
3407 {
3408 aco_save_T aco;
3409 int do_set_w_closing = term->tl_buffer->b_nwindows == 0;
3410#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
3411 win_T *pwin = NULL((void*)0);
3412
3413 // If this was a terminal in a popup window, go back to the
3414 // previous window.
3415 if (popup_is_popup(curwin) && curbuf == term->tl_buffer)
3416 {
3417 pwin = curwin;
3418 if (win_valid(prevwin))
3419 win_enter(prevwin, FALSE0);
3420 }
3421 else
3422#endif
3423 // If this is the last normal window: exit Vim.
3424 if (term->tl_buffer->b_nwindows > 0 && only_one_window())
3425 {
3426 exarg_T ea;
3427
3428 CLEAR_FIELD(ea)memset((&(ea)), (0), (sizeof(ea)));
Call to function 'memset' is insecure as it does not provide security checks introduced in the C11 standard. Replace with analogous functions that support length arguments or provides boundary checks such as 'memset_s' in case of C11
3429 ex_quit(&ea);
3430 return TRUE1;
3431 }
3432
3433 // ++close or term_finish == "close"
3434 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "terminal job finished, closing window");
3435 aucmd_prepbuf(&aco, term->tl_buffer);
3436 // Avoid closing the window if we temporarily use it.
3437 if (curwin == aucmd_win)
3438 do_set_w_closing = TRUE1;
3439 if (do_set_w_closing)
3440 curwin->w_closing = TRUE1;
3441 do_bufdel(DOBUF_WIPE4, (char_u *)"", 1, fnum, fnum, FALSE0);
3442 if (do_set_w_closing)
3443 curwin->w_closing = FALSE0;
3444 aucmd_restbuf(&aco);
3445#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
3446 if (pwin != NULL((void*)0))
3447 popup_close_with_retval(pwin, 0);
3448#endif
3449 return TRUE1;
3450 }
3451 if (term->tl_finish == TL_FINISH_OPEN'o'
3452 && term->tl_buffer->b_nwindows == 0)
3453 {
3454 char *cmd = term->tl_opencmd == NULL((void*)0)
3455 ? "botright sbuf %d"
3456 : (char *)term->tl_opencmd;
3457 size_t len = strlen(cmd) + 50;
3458 char *buf = alloc(len);
3459
3460 if (buf != NULL((void*)0))
3461 {
3462 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "terminal job finished, opening window");
3463 vim_snprintf(buf, len, cmd, fnum);
3464 do_cmdline_cmd((char_u *)buf);
3465 vim_free(buf);
3466 }
3467 }
3468 else
3469 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "terminal job finished");
3470 }
3471
3472 redraw_buf_and_status_later(term->tl_buffer, NOT_VALID40);
3473 return FALSE0;
3474}

3482 int
3483may_close_term_popup(void)

3499/*
3500 * Called when a channel has been closed.
3501 * If this was a channel for a terminal window then finish it up.
3502 */
3503 void
3504term_channel_closed(channel_T *ch)
3505{
3506 term_T *term;
3507 term_T *next_term;
3508 int did_one = FALSE0;
3509
3510 for (term = first_term; term != NULL((void*)0); term = next_term)
3511 {
3512 next_term = term->tl_next;
3513 if (term->tl_job == ch->ch_job && !term->tl_channel_closed)
3514 {
3515 term->tl_channel_closed = TRUE1;
3516 did_one = TRUE1;
3517
3518 VIM_CLEAR(term->tl_title)do { if ((term->tl_title) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(term->
tl_title); (term->tl_title) = ((void*)0); } } while (0);
3519 VIM_CLEAR(term->tl_status_text)do { if ((term->tl_status_text) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(
term->tl_status_text); (term->tl_status_text) = ((void*
)0); } } while (0);
3520#ifdef MSWIN
3521 if (term->tl_out_fd != NULL((void*)0))
3522 {
3523 fclose(term->tl_out_fd);
3524 term->tl_out_fd = NULL((void*)0);
3525 }
3526#endif
3527
3528 if (updating_screen)
3529 {
3530 // Cannot open or close windows now. Can happen when
3531 // 'lazyredraw' is set.
3532 term->tl_channel_recently_closed = TRUE1;
3533 continue;
3534 }
3535
3536 if (term_after_channel_closed(term))
3537 next_term = first_term;
3538 }
3539 }
3540
3541 if (did_one)
3542 {
3543 redraw_statuslines();
3544
3545 // Need to break out of vgetc().
3546 ins_char_typebuf(K_IGNORE(-((253) + ((int)(KE_IGNORE) << 8))), 0);
3547 typebuf_was_filled = TRUE1;
3548
3549 term = curbuf->b_term;
3550 if (term != NULL((void*)0))
3551 {
3552 if (term->tl_job == ch->ch_job)
3553 maketitle();
3554 update_cursor(term, term->tl_cursor_visible);
3555 }
3556 }
3557}

3559/*
3560 * To be called after resetting updating_screen: handle any terminal where the
3561 * channel was closed.
3562 */
3563 void
3564term_check_channel_closed_recently()
3565{
3566 term_T *term;
3567 term_T *next_term;
3568
3569 for (term = first_term; term != NULL((void*)0); term = next_term)
3570 {
3571 next_term = term->tl_next;
3572 if (term->tl_channel_recently_closed)
3573 {
3574 term->tl_channel_recently_closed = FALSE0;
3575 if (term_after_channel_closed(term))
3576 // start over, the list may have changed
3577 next_term = first_term;
3578 }
3579 }
3580}

3582/*
3583 * Fill one screen line from a line of the terminal.
3584 * Advances "pos" to past the last column.
3585 */
3586 static void
3587term_line2screenline(
3588 term_T *term,
3589 win_T *wp,
3590 VTermScreen *screen,
3591 VTermPos *pos,
3592 int max_col)
3593{
3594 int off = screen_get_current_line_off();
3595
3596 for (pos->col = 0; pos->col < max_col; )
3597 {
3598 VTermScreenCell cell;
3599 int c;
3600
3601 if (vterm_screen_get_cell(screen, *pos, &cell) == 0)
3602 CLEAR_FIELD(cell)memset((&(cell)), (0), (sizeof(cell)));
3603
3604 c = cell.chars[0];
3605 if (c == NUL'\000')
3606 {
3607 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
3608 if (enc_utf8)
3609 ScreenLinesUC[off] = NUL'\000';
3610 }
3611 else
3612 {
3613 if (enc_utf8)
3614 {
3615 int i;
3616
3617 // composing chars
3618 for (i = 0; i < Screen_mco
3619 && i + 1 < VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6; ++i)
3620 {
3621 ScreenLinesC[i][off] = cell.chars[i + 1];
3622 if (cell.chars[i + 1] == 0)
3623 break;
3624 }
3625 if (c >= 0x80 || (Screen_mco > 0
3626 && ScreenLinesC[0][off] != 0))
3627 {
3628 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
3629 ScreenLinesUC[off] = c;
3630 }
3631 else
3632 {
3633 ScreenLines[off] = c;
3634 ScreenLinesUC[off] = NUL'\000';
3635 }
3636 }
3637#ifdef MSWIN
3638 else if (has_mbyte && c >= 0x80)
3639 {
3640 char_u mb[MB_MAXBYTES21+1];
3641 WCHAR wc = c;
3642
3643 if (WideCharToMultiByte(GetACP(), 0, &wc, 1,
3644 (char*)mb, 2, 0, 0) > 1)
3645 {
3646 ScreenLines[off] = mb[0];
3647 ScreenLines[off + 1] = mb[1];
3648 cell.width = mb_ptr2cells(mb);
3649 }
3650 else
3651 ScreenLines[off] = c;
3652 }
3653#endif
3654 else
3655 // This will only store the lower byte of "c".
3656 ScreenLines[off] = c;
3657 }
3658 ScreenAttrs[off] = cell2attr(term, wp, cell.attrs, cell.fg, cell.bg);
3659
3660 ++pos->col;
3661 ++off;
3662 if (cell.width == 2)
3663 {
3664 // don't set the second byte to NUL for a DBCS encoding, it
3665 // has been set above
3666 if (enc_utf8)
3667 {
3668 ScreenLinesUC[off] = NUL'\000';
3669 ScreenLines[off] = NUL'\000';
3670 }
3671 else if (!has_mbyte)
3672 {
3673 // Can't show a double-width character with a single-byte
3674 // 'encoding', just use a space.
3675 ScreenLines[off] = ' ';
3676 ScreenAttrs[off] = ScreenAttrs[off - 1];
3677 }
3678
3679 ++pos->col;
3680 ++off;
3681 }
3682 }
3683}
3684
3685#if defined(FEAT_GUI)
3686 static void
3687update_system_term(term_T *term)
3688{
3689 VTermPos pos;
3690 VTermScreen *screen;
3691
3692 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
3693 return;
3694 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(term->tl_vterm);
3695
3696 // Scroll up to make more room for terminal lines if needed.
3697 while (term->tl_toprow > 0
3698 && (Rows - term->tl_toprow) < term->tl_dirty_row_end)
3699 {
3700 int save_p_more = p_more;
3701
3702 p_more = FALSE0;
3703 msg_row = Rows - 1;
3704 msg_puts("\n");
3705 p_more = save_p_more;
3706 --term->tl_toprow;
3707 }
3708
3709 for (pos.row = term->tl_dirty_row_start; pos.row < term->tl_dirty_row_end
3710 && pos.row < Rows; ++pos.row)
3711 {
3712 if (pos.row < term->tl_rows)
3713 {
3714 int max_col = MIN(Columns, term->tl_cols)(((Columns)<(term->tl_cols))?(Columns):(term->tl_cols
));
3715
3716 term_line2screenline(term, NULL((void*)0), screen, &pos, max_col);
3717 }
3718 else
3719 pos.col = 0;
3720
3721 screen_line(term->tl_toprow + pos.row, 0, pos.col, Columns, 0);
3722 }
3723
3724 term->tl_dirty_row_start = MAX_ROW999999;
3725 term->tl_dirty_row_end = 0;
3726}
3727#endif

3729/*
3730 * Return TRUE if window "wp" is to be redrawn with term_update_window().
3731 * Returns FALSE when there is no terminal running in this window or it is in
3732 * Terminal-Normal mode.
3733 */
3734 int
3735term_do_update_window(win_T *wp)
3736{
3737 term_T *term = wp->w_buffer->b_term;
3738
3739 return term != NULL((void*)0) && term->tl_vterm != NULL((void*)0) && !term->tl_normal_mode;
3740}
3741
3742/*
3743 * Called to update a window that contains an active terminal.
3744 */
3745 void
3746term_update_window(win_T *wp)
3747{
3748 term_T *term = wp->w_buffer->b_term;
3749 VTerm *vterm;
3750 VTermScreen *screen;
3751 VTermState *state;
3752 VTermPos pos;
3753 int rows, cols;
3754 int newrows, newcols;
3755 int minsize;
3756 win_T *twp;
3757
3758 vterm = term->tl_vterm;
3759 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(vterm);
3760 state = vterm_obtain_state(vterm);
3761
3762 // We use NOT_VALID on a resize or scroll, redraw everything then. With
3763 // SOME_VALID only redraw what was marked dirty.
3764 if (wp->w_redr_type > SOME_VALID35)
3765 {
3766 term->tl_dirty_row_start = 0;
3767 term->tl_dirty_row_end = MAX_ROW999999;
3768
3769 if (term->tl_postponed_scroll > 0
3770 && term->tl_postponed_scroll < term->tl_rows / 3)
3771 // Scrolling is usually faster than redrawing, when there are only
3772 // a few lines to scroll.
3773 term_scroll_up(term, 0, term->tl_postponed_scroll);
3774 term->tl_postponed_scroll = 0;
3775 }
3776
3777 /*
3778 * If the window was resized a redraw will be triggered and we get here.
3779 * Adjust the size of the vterm unless 'termwinsize' specifies a fixed size.
3780 */
3781 minsize = parse_termwinsize(wp, &rows, &cols);
3782
3783 newrows = 99999;
3784 newcols = 99999;
3785 for (twp = firstwin; ; twp = twp->w_next)
3786 {
3787 // Always use curwin, it may be a popup window.
3788 win_T *wwp = twp == NULL((void*)0) ? curwin : twp;
3789
3790 // When more than one window shows the same terminal, use the
3791 // smallest size.
3792 if (wwp->w_buffer == term->tl_buffer)
3793 {
3794 newrows = MIN(newrows, wwp->w_height)(((newrows)<(wwp->w_height))?(newrows):(wwp->w_height
));
3795 newcols = MIN(newcols, wwp->w_width)(((newcols)<(wwp->w_width))?(newcols):(wwp->w_width)
);
3796 }
3797 if (twp == NULL((void*)0))
3798 break;
3799 }
3800 if (newrows == 99999 || newcols == 99999)
3801 return; // safety exit
3802 newrows = rows == 0 ? newrows : minsize ? MAX(rows, newrows)(((rows)>(newrows))?(rows):(newrows)) : rows;
3803 newcols = cols == 0 ? newcols : minsize ? MAX(cols, newcols)(((cols)>(newcols))?(cols):(newcols)) : cols;
3804
3805 if (term->tl_rows != newrows || term->tl_cols != newcols)
3806 {
3807 term->tl_vterm_size_changed = TRUE1;
3808 vterm_set_size(vterm, newrows, newcols);
3809 ch_log(term->tl_job->jv_channel, "Resizing terminal to %d lines",
3810 newrows);
3811 term_report_winsize(term, newrows, newcols);
3812
3813 // Updating the terminal size will cause the snapshot to be cleared.
3814 // When not in terminal_loop() we need to restore it.
3815 if (term != in_terminal_loop)
3816 may_move_terminal_to_buffer(term, FALSE0);
3817 }
3818
3819 // The cursor may have been moved when resizing.
3820 vterm_state_get_cursorpos(state, &pos);
3821 position_cursor(wp, &pos, FALSE0);
3822
3823 for (pos.row = term->tl_dirty_row_start; pos.row < term->tl_dirty_row_end
3824 && pos.row < wp->w_height; ++pos.row)
3825 {
3826 if (pos.row < term->tl_rows)
3827 {
3828 int max_col = MIN(wp->w_width, term->tl_cols)(((wp->w_width)<(term->tl_cols))?(wp->w_width):(term
->tl_cols));
3829
3830 term_line2screenline(term, wp, screen, &pos, max_col);
3831 }
3832 else
3833 pos.col = 0;
3834
3835 screen_line(wp->w_winrow + pos.row
3836#ifdef FEAT_MENU
3837 + winbar_height(wp)
3838#endif
3839 , wp->w_wincol, pos.col, wp->w_width,
3840#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP
3841 popup_is_popup(wp) ? SLF_POPUP2 :
3842#endif
3843 0);
3844 }
3845 term->tl_dirty_row_start = MAX_ROW999999;
3846 term->tl_dirty_row_end = 0;
3847}

3849/*
3850 * Return TRUE if "wp" is a terminal window where the job has finished.
3851 */
3852 int
3853term_is_finished(buf_T *buf)
3854{
3855 return buf->b_term != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0);
3856}
3857
3858/*
3859 * Return TRUE if "wp" is a terminal window where the job has finished or we
3860 * are in Terminal-Normal mode, thus we show the buffer contents.
3861 */
3862 int
3863term_show_buffer(buf_T *buf)
3864{
3865 term_T *term = buf->b_term;
3866
3867 return term != NULL((void*)0) && (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0) || term->tl_normal_mode);
3868}
3869
3870/*
3871 * The current buffer is going to be changed. If there is terminal
3872 * highlighting remove it now.
3873 */
3874 void
3875term_change_in_curbuf(void)
3876{
3877 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
3878
3879 if (term_is_finished(curbuf) && term->tl_scrollback.ga_len > 0)
3880 {
3881 free_scrollback(term);
3882 redraw_buf_later(term->tl_buffer, NOT_VALID40);
3883
3884 // The buffer is now like a normal buffer, it cannot be easily
3885 // abandoned when changed.
3886 set_string_option_direct((char_u *)"buftype", -1,
3887 (char_u *)"", OPT_FREE0x01|OPT_LOCAL0x04, 0);
3888 }
3889}

3891/*
3892 * Get the screen attribute for a position in the buffer.
3893 * Use a negative "col" to get the filler background color.
3894 */
3895 int
3896term_get_attr(win_T *wp, linenr_T lnum, int col)
3897{
3898 buf_T *buf = wp->w_buffer;
3899 term_T *term = buf->b_term;
3900 sb_line_T *line;
3901 cellattr_T *cellattr;
3902
3903 if (lnum > term->tl_scrollback.ga_len)
3904 cellattr = &term->tl_default_color;
3905 else
3906 {
3907 line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data + lnum - 1;
3908 if (col < 0 || col >= line->sb_cols)
3909 cellattr = &line->sb_fill_attr;
3910 else
3911 cellattr = line->sb_cells + col;
3912 }
3913 return cell2attr(term, wp, cellattr->attrs, cellattr->fg, cellattr->bg);
3914}

3916/*
3917 * Convert a cterm color number 0 - 255 to RGB.
3918 * This is compatible with xterm.
3919 */
3920 static void
3921cterm_color2vterm(int nr, VTermColor *rgb)
3922{
3923 cterm_color2rgb(nr, &rgb->red, &rgb->green, &rgb->blue, &rgb->index);
3924 if (rgb->index == 0)
3925 rgb->type = VTERM_COLOR_RGB;
3926 else
3927 {
3928 rgb->type = VTERM_COLOR_INDEXED;
3929 --rgb->index;
3930 }
3931}

3933/*
3934 * Initialize term->tl_default_color from the environment.
3935 */
3936 static void
3937init_default_colors(term_T *term, win_T *wp)
3938{
3939 VTermColor *fg, *bg;
3940 int fgval, bgval;
3941 int id;
3942
3943 CLEAR_FIELD(term->tl_default_color.attrs)memset((&(term->tl_default_color.attrs)), (0), (sizeof
(term->tl_default_color.attrs)));
3944 term->tl_default_color.width = 1;
3945 fg = &term->tl_default_color.fg;
3946 bg = &term->tl_default_color.bg;
3947
3948 // Vterm uses a default black background. Set it to white when
3949 // 'background' is "light".
3950 if (*p_bg == 'l')
3951 {
3952 fgval = 0;
3953 bgval = 255;
3954 }
3955 else
3956 {
3957 fgval = 255;
3958 bgval = 0;
3959 }
3960 fg->red = fg->green = fg->blue = fgval;
3961 bg->red = bg->green = bg->blue = bgval;
3962 fg->type = VTERM_COLOR_RGB | VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_FG;
3963 bg->type = VTERM_COLOR_RGB | VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_BG;
3964
3965 // The 'wincolor' or the highlight group overrules the defaults.
3966 if (wp != NULL((void*)0) && *wp->w_p_wcrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wcr != NUL'\000')
3967 id = syn_name2id(wp->w_p_wcrw_onebuf_opt.wo_wcr);
3968 else
3969 id = syn_name2id(term_get_highlight_name(term));
3970
3971 // Use the actual color for the GUI and when 'termguicolors' is set.
3972#if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS)
3973 if (0
3974# ifdef FEAT_GUI
3975 || gui.in_use
3976# endif
3977# ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
3978 || p_tgc
3979# ifdef FEAT_VTP
3980 // Finally get INVALCOLOR on this execution path
3981 || (!p_tgc && t_colors >= 256)
3982# endif
3983# endif
3984 )
3985 {
3986 guicolor_Tlong fg_rgb = INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff);
3987 guicolor_Tlong bg_rgb = INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff);
3988
3989 if (id != 0)
3990 syn_id2colors(id, &fg_rgb, &bg_rgb);
3991
3992# ifdef FEAT_GUI
3993 if (gui.in_use)
3994 {
3995 if (fg_rgb == INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
3996 fg_rgb = gui.norm_pixel;
3997 if (bg_rgb == INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
3998 bg_rgb = gui.back_pixel;
3999 }
4000# ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
4001 else
4002# endif
4003# endif
4004# ifdef FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS
4005 {
4006 if (fg_rgb == INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
4007 fg_rgb = cterm_normal_fg_gui_color;
4008 if (bg_rgb == INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
4009 bg_rgb = cterm_normal_bg_gui_color;
4010 }
4011# endif
4012 if (fg_rgb != INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
4013 {
4014 long_u rgb = GUI_MCH_GET_RGBtermgui_mch_get_rgb(fg_rgb);
4015
4016 fg->red = (unsigned)(rgb >> 16);
4017 fg->green = (unsigned)(rgb >> 8) & 255;
4018 fg->blue = (unsigned)rgb & 255;
4019 }
4020 if (bg_rgb != INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
4021 {
4022 long_u rgb = GUI_MCH_GET_RGBtermgui_mch_get_rgb(bg_rgb);
4023
4024 bg->red = (unsigned)(rgb >> 16);
4025 bg->green = (unsigned)(rgb >> 8) & 255;
4026 bg->blue = (unsigned)rgb & 255;
4027 }
4028 }
4029 else
4030#endif
4031 if (id != 0 && t_colors >= 16)
4032 {
4033 int cterm_fg = get_default_cterm_fg(term);
4034 int cterm_bg = get_default_cterm_bg(term);
4035
4036 if (cterm_fg >= 0)
4037 cterm_color2vterm(cterm_fg, fg);
4038 if (cterm_bg >= 0)
4039 cterm_color2vterm(cterm_bg, bg);
4040 }
4041 else
4042 {
4043#if defined(MSWIN) && (!defined(FEAT_GUI_MSWIN) || defined(VIMDLL))
4044 int tmp;
4045#endif
4046
4047 // In an MS-Windows console we know the normal colors.
4048 if (cterm_normal_fg_color > 0)
4049 {
4050 cterm_color2vterm(cterm_normal_fg_color - 1, fg);
4051# if defined(MSWIN) && (!defined(FEAT_GUI_MSWIN) || defined(VIMDLL))
4052# ifdef VIMDLL
4053 if (!gui.in_use)
4054# endif
4055 {
4056 tmp = fg->red;
4057 fg->red = fg->blue;
4058 fg->blue = tmp;
4059 }
4060# endif
4061 }
4062# ifdef FEAT_TERMRESPONSE
4063 else
4064 term_get_fg_color(&fg->red, &fg->green, &fg->blue);
4065# endif
4066
4067 if (cterm_normal_bg_color > 0)
4068 {
4069 cterm_color2vterm(cterm_normal_bg_color - 1, bg);
4070# if defined(MSWIN) && (!defined(FEAT_GUI_MSWIN) || defined(VIMDLL))
4071# ifdef VIMDLL
4072 if (!gui.in_use)
4073# endif
4074 {
4075 tmp = fg->red;
4076 fg->red = fg->blue;
4077 fg->blue = tmp;
4078 }
4079# endif
4080 }
4081# ifdef FEAT_TERMRESPONSE
4082 else
4083 term_get_bg_color(&bg->red, &bg->green, &bg->blue);
4084# endif
4085 }
4086}

4089/*
4090 * Set the 16 ANSI colors from array of RGB values
4091 */
4092 static void
4093set_vterm_palette(VTerm *vterm, long_u *rgb)
4094{
4095 int index = 0;
4096 VTermState *state = vterm_obtain_state(vterm);
4097
4098 for (; index < 16; index++)
4099 {
4100 VTermColor color;
4101
4102 color.red = (unsigned)(rgb[index] >> 16);
4103 color.green = (unsigned)(rgb[index] >> 8) & 255;
4104 color.blue = (unsigned)rgb[index] & 255;
4105 vterm_state_set_palette_color(state, index, &color);
4106 }
4107}

4109/*
4110 * Set the ANSI color palette from a list of colors
4111 */
4112 static int
4113set_ansi_colors_list(VTerm *vterm, list_T *list)
4114{
4115 int n = 0;
4116 long_u rgb[16];
4117 listitem_T *li;
4118
4119 for (li = list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0) && n < 16; li = li->li_next, n++)
4120 {
4121 char_u *color_name;
4122 guicolor_Tlong guicolor;
4123
4124 color_name = tv_get_string_chk(&li->li_tv);
4125 if (color_name == NULL((void*)0))
4126 return FAIL0;
4127
4128 guicolor = GUI_GET_COLORtermgui_get_color(color_name);
4129 if (guicolor == INVALCOLOR((long)0x1ffffff))
4130 return FAIL0;
4131
4132 rgb[n] = GUI_MCH_GET_RGBtermgui_mch_get_rgb(guicolor);
4133 }
4134
4135 if (n != 16 || li != NULL((void*)0))
4136 return FAIL0;
4137
4138 set_vterm_palette(vterm, rgb);
4139
4140 return OK1;
4141}

4160/*
4161 * Handles a "drop" command from the job in the terminal.
4162 * "item" is the file name, "item->li_next" may have options.
4163 */
4164 static void
4165handle_drop_command(listitem_T *item)
4166{
4167 char_u *fname = tv_get_string(&item->li_tv);
4168 listitem_T *opt_item = item->li_next;
4169 int bufnr;
4170 win_T *wp;
4171 tabpage_T *tp;
4172 exarg_T ea;
4173 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
4174
4175 bufnr = buflist_add(fname, BLN_LISTED2 | BLN_NOOPT16);
4176 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for ((tp) = first_tabpage; (tp) != ((void*)0); (tp) = (tp)->
tp_next) for ((wp) = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (tp)->tp_firstwin
; (wp); (wp) = (wp)->w_next)
4177 {
4178 if (wp->w_buffer->b_fnum == bufnr)
4179 {
4180 // buffer is in a window already, go there
4181 goto_tabpage_win(tp, wp);
4182 return;
4183 }
4184 }
4185
4186 CLEAR_FIELD(ea)memset((&(ea)), (0), (sizeof(ea)));
4187
4188 if (opt_item != NULL((void*)0) && opt_item->li_tv.v_type == VAR_DICT
4189 && opt_item->li_tv.vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0))
4190 {
4191 dict_T *dict = opt_item->li_tv.vval.v_dict;
4192 char_u *p;
4193
4194 p = dict_get_string(dict, (char_u *)"ff", FALSE0);
4195 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
4196 p = dict_get_string(dict, (char_u *)"fileformat", FALSE0);
4197 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
4198 {
4199 if (check_ff_value(p) == FAIL0)
4200 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "Invalid ff argument to drop: %s", p);
4201 else
4202 ea.force_ff = *p;
4203 }
4204 p = dict_get_string(dict, (char_u *)"enc", FALSE0);
4205 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
4206 p = dict_get_string(dict, (char_u *)"encoding", FALSE0);
4207 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
4208 {
4209 ea.cmd = alloc(STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)) + 12);
4210 if (ea.cmd != NULL((void*)0))
4211 {
4212 sprintf((char *)ea.cmd, "sbuf ++enc=%s", p)__builtin___sprintf_chk ((char *)ea.cmd, 1 - 1, __builtin_object_size
((char *)ea.cmd, 1 > 1), "sbuf ++enc=%s", p);
4213 ea.force_enc = 11;
4214 tofree = ea.cmd;
4215 }
4216 }
4217
4218 p = dict_get_string(dict, (char_u *)"bad", FALSE0);
4219 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
4220 get_bad_opt(p, &ea);
4221
4222 if (dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"bin", -1) != NULL((void*)0))
4223 ea.force_bin = FORCE_BIN1;
4224 if (dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"binary", -1) != NULL((void*)0))
4225 ea.force_bin = FORCE_BIN1;
4226 if (dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"nobin", -1) != NULL((void*)0))
4227 ea.force_bin = FORCE_NOBIN2;
4228 if (dict_find(dict, (char_u *)"nobinary", -1) != NULL((void*)0))
4229 ea.force_bin = FORCE_NOBIN2;
4230 }
4231
4232 // open in new window, like ":split fname"
4233 if (ea.cmd == NULL((void*)0))
4234 ea.cmd = (char_u *)"split";
4235 ea.arg = fname;
4236 ea.cmdidx = CMD_split;
4237 ex_splitview(&ea);
4238
4239 vim_free(tofree);
4240}

4242/*
4243 * Return TRUE if "func" starts with "pat" and "pat" isn't empty.
4244 */
4245 static int
4246is_permitted_term_api(char_u *func, char_u *pat)
4247{
4248 return pat != NULL((void*)0) && *pat != NUL'\000' && STRNICMP(func, pat, STRLEN(pat))strncasecmp((char *)(func), (char *)(pat), (size_t)(strlen((char
*)(pat)))) == 0;
4249}

4251/*
4252 * Handles a function call from the job running in a terminal.
4253 * "item" is the function name, "item->li_next" has the arguments.
4254 */
4255 static void
4256handle_call_command(term_T *term, channel_T *channel, listitem_T *item)
4257{
4258 char_u *func;
4259 typval_T argvars[2];
4260 typval_T rettv;
4261 funcexe_T funcexe;
4262
4263 if (item->li_next == NULL((void*)0))
4264 {
4265 ch_log(channel, "Missing function arguments for call");
4266 return;
4267 }
4268 func = tv_get_string(&item->li_tv);
4269
4270 if (!is_permitted_term_api(func, term->tl_api))
4271 {
4272 ch_log(channel, "Unpermitted function: %s", func);
4273 return;
4274 }
4275
4276 argvars[0].v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
4277 argvars[0].vval.v_number = term->tl_buffer->b_fnum;
4278 argvars[1] = item->li_next->li_tv;
4279 CLEAR_FIELD(funcexe)memset((&(funcexe)), (0), (sizeof(funcexe)));
4280 funcexe.firstline = 1L;
4281 funcexe.lastline = 1L;
4282 funcexe.evaluate = TRUE1;
4283 if (call_func(func, -1, &rettv, 2, argvars, &funcexe) == OK1)
4284 {
4285 clear_tv(&rettv);
4286 ch_log(channel, "Function %s called", func);
4287 }
4288 else
4289 ch_log(channel, "Calling function %s failed", func);
4290}
4291
4292/*
4293 * Called by libvterm when it cannot recognize an OSC sequence.
4294 * We recognize a terminal API command.
4295 */
4296 static int
4297parse_osc(int command, VTermStringFragment frag, void *user)
4298{
4299 term_T *term = (term_T *)user;
4300 js_read_T reader;
4301 typval_T tv;
4302 channel_T *channel = term->tl_job == NULL((void*)0) ? NULL((void*)0)
4303 : term->tl_job->jv_channel;
4304 garray_T *gap = &term->tl_osc_buf;
4305
4306 // We recognize only OSC 5 1 ; {command}
4307 if (command != 51)
4308 return 0;
4309
4310 // Concatenate what was received until the final piece is found.
4311 if (ga_grow(gap, (int)frag.len + 1) == FAIL0)
4312 {
4313 ga_clear(gap);
4314 return 1;
4315 }
4316 mch_memmove((char *)gap->ga_data + gap->ga_len, frag.str, frag.len)memmove((char *)((char *)gap->ga_data + gap->ga_len), (
char *)(frag.str), frag.len);
4317 gap->ga_len += (int)frag.len;
4318 if (!frag.final)
4319 return 1;
4320
4321 ((char *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len] = 0;
4322 reader.js_buf = gap->ga_data;
4323 reader.js_fill = NULL((void*)0);
4324 reader.js_used = 0;
4325 if (json_decode(&reader, &tv, 0) == OK1
4326 && tv.v_type == VAR_LIST
4327 && tv.vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
4328 {
4329 listitem_T *item = tv.vval.v_list->lv_first;
4330
4331 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
4332 ch_log(channel, "Missing command");
4333 else
4334 {
4335 char_u *cmd = tv_get_string(&item->li_tv);
4336
4337 // Make sure an invoked command doesn't delete the buffer (and the
4338 // terminal) under our fingers.
4339 ++term->tl_buffer->b_locked;
4340
4341 item = item->li_next;
4342 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
4343 ch_log(channel, "Missing argument for %s", cmd);
4344 else if (STRCMP(cmd, "drop")strcmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("drop")) == 0)
4345 handle_drop_command(item);
4346 else if (STRCMP(cmd, "call")strcmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("call")) == 0)
4347 handle_call_command(term, channel, item);
4348 else
4349 ch_log(channel, "Invalid command received: %s", cmd);
4350 --term->tl_buffer->b_locked;
4351 }
4352 }
4353 else
4354 ch_log(channel, "Invalid JSON received");
4355
4356 ga_clear(gap);
4357 clear_tv(&tv);
4358 return 1;
4359}
4360
4361/*
4362 * Called by libvterm when it cannot recognize a CSI sequence.
4363 * We recognize the window position report.
4364 */
4365 static int
4366parse_csi(
4367 const char *leader UNUSED__attribute__((unused)),
4368 const long args[],
4369 int argcount,
4370 const char *intermed UNUSED__attribute__((unused)),
4371 char command,
4372 void *user)
4373{
4374 term_T *term = (term_T *)user;
4375 char buf[100];
4376 int len;
4377 int x = 0;
4378 int y = 0;
4379 win_T *wp;
4380
4381 // We recognize only CSI 13 t
4382 if (command != 't' || argcount != 1 || args[0] != 13)
4383 return 0; // not handled
4384
4385 // When getting the window position is not possible or it fails it results
4386 // in zero/zero.
4387#if defined(FEAT_GUI) \
4388 || (defined(HAVE_TGETENT1) && defined(FEAT_TERMRESPONSE)) \
4389 || defined(MSWIN)
4390 (void)ui_get_winpos(&x, &y, (varnumber_T)100);
4391#endif
4392
4393 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (wp = firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next)
4394 if (wp->w_buffer == term->tl_buffer)
4395 break;
4396 if (wp != NULL((void*)0))
4397 {
4398#ifdef FEAT_GUI
4399 if (gui.in_use)
4400 {
4401 x += wp->w_wincol * gui.char_width;
4402 y += W_WINROW(wp)(wp->w_winrow + wp->w_winbar_height) * gui.char_height;
4403 }
4404 else
4405#endif
4406 {
4407 // We roughly estimate the position of the terminal window inside
4408 // the Vim window by assuming a 10 x 7 character cell.
4409 x += wp->w_wincol * 7;
4410 y += W_WINROW(wp)(wp->w_winrow + wp->w_winbar_height) * 10;
4411 }
4412 }
4413
4414 len = vim_snprintf(buf, 100, "\x1b[3;%d;%dt", x, y);
4415 channel_send(term->tl_job->jv_channel, get_tty_part(term),
4416 (char_u *)buf, len, NULL((void*)0));
4417 return 1;
4418}

4420static VTermStateFallbacks state_fallbacks = {
4421 NULL((void*)0), // control
4422 parse_csi, // csi
4423 parse_osc, // osc
4424 NULL((void*)0) // dcs
4425};

4437vterm_memfree(void *ptr, void *data UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
4438{

4440}

4443 &vterm_malloc,
4444 &vterm_memfree
4445};

4447/*
4448 * Create a new vterm and initialize it.
4449 * Return FAIL when out of memory.
4450 */
4451 static int
4452create_vterm(term_T *term, int rows, int cols)
4453{
4454 VTerm *vterm;
4455 VTermScreen *screen;
4456 VTermState *state;
4457 VTermValue value;
4458
4459 vterm = vterm_new_with_allocator(rows, cols, &vterm_allocator, NULL((void*)0));
4460 term->tl_vterm = vterm;
4461 if (vterm == NULL((void*)0))
4462 return FAIL0;
4463
4464 // Allocate screen and state here, so we can bail out if that fails.
4465 state = vterm_obtain_state(vterm);
4466 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(vterm);
4467 if (state == NULL((void*)0) || screen == NULL((void*)0))
4468 {
4469 vterm_free(vterm);
4470 return FAIL0;
4471 }
4472
4473 vterm_screen_set_callbacks(screen, &screen_callbacks, term);
4474 // TODO: depends on 'encoding'.
4475 vterm_set_utf8(vterm, 1);
4476
4477 init_default_colors(term, NULL((void*)0));
4478
4479 vterm_state_set_default_colors(
4480 state,
4481 &term->tl_default_color.fg,
4482 &term->tl_default_color.bg);
4483
4484 if (t_colors < 16)
4485 // Less than 16 colors: assume that bold means using a bright color for
4486 // the foreground color.
4487 vterm_state_set_bold_highbright(vterm_obtain_state(vterm), 1);
4488
4489 // Required to initialize most things.
4490 vterm_screen_reset(screen, 1 /* hard */);
4491
4492 // Allow using alternate screen.
4493 vterm_screen_enable_altscreen(screen, 1);
4494
4495 // For unix do not use a blinking cursor. In an xterm this causes the
4496 // cursor to blink if it's blinking in the xterm.
4497 // For Windows we respect the system wide setting.
4498#ifdef MSWIN
4499 if (GetCaretBlinkTime() == INFINITE)
4500 value.boolean = 0;
4501 else
4502 value.boolean = 1;
4503#else
4504 value.boolean = 0;
4505#endif
4506 vterm_state_set_termprop(state, VTERM_PROP_CURSORBLINK, &value);
4507 vterm_state_set_unrecognised_fallbacks(state, &state_fallbacks, term);
4508
4509 return OK1;
4510}

4527
4528 redraw_later(NOT_VALID40);
4529}

4531/*
4532 * Return the text to show for the buffer name and status.
4533 */
4534 char_u *
4535term_get_status_text(term_T *term)
4536{
4537 if (term->tl_status_text == NULL((void*)0))
4538 {
4539 char_u *txt;
4540 size_t len;
4541 char_u *fname;
4542
4543 if (term->tl_normal_mode)
4544 {
4545 if (term_job_running(term))
4546 txt = (char_u *)_("Terminal")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Terminal"), 5);
4547 else
4548 txt = (char_u *)_("Terminal-finished")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Terminal-finished"), 5);
4549 }
4550 else if (term->tl_title != NULL((void*)0))
4551 txt = term->tl_title;
4552 else if (term_none_open(term))
4553 txt = (char_u *)_("active")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("active"), 5);
4554 else if (term_job_running(term))
4555 txt = (char_u *)_("running")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("running"), 5);
4556 else
4557 txt = (char_u *)_("finished")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("finished"), 5);
4558 fname = buf_get_fname(term->tl_buffer);
4559 len = 9 + STRLEN(fname)strlen((char *)(fname)) + STRLEN(txt)strlen((char *)(txt));
4560 term->tl_status_text = alloc(len);
4561 if (term->tl_status_text != NULL((void*)0))
4562 vim_snprintf((char *)term->tl_status_text, len, "%s [%s]",
4563 fname, txt);
4564 }
4565 return term->tl_status_text;
4566}

4610 static void
4611clear_cell(VTermScreenCell *cell)

4614 cell->fg.type = VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_FG;
4615 cell->bg.type = VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_BG;
4616}
4617
4618 static void
4619dump_term_color(FILE *fd, VTermColor *color)
4620{
4621 int index;
4622
4623 if (VTERM_COLOR_IS_INDEXED(color)(((color)->type & VTERM_COLOR_TYPE_MASK) == VTERM_COLOR_INDEXED
))
4624 index = color->index + 1;
4625 else if (color->type == 0)
4626 // use RGB values
4627 index = 255;
4628 else
4629 // default color
4630 index = 0;
4631 fprintf(fd, "%02x%02x%02x%d",
4632 (int)color->red, (int)color->green, (int)color->blue,
4633 index);
4634}
4635
4636/*
4637 * "term_dumpwrite(buf, filename, options)" function
4638 *
4639 * Each screen cell in full is:
4640 * |{characters}+{attributes}#{fg-color}{color-idx}#{bg-color}{color-idx}
4641 * {characters} is a space for an empty cell
4642 * For a double-width character "+" is changed to "*" and the next cell is
4643 * skipped.
4644 * {attributes} is the decimal value of HL_BOLD + HL_UNDERLINE, etc.
4645 * when "&" use the same as the previous cell.
4646 * {fg-color} is hex RGB, when "&" use the same as the previous cell.
4647 * {bg-color} is hex RGB, when "&" use the same as the previous cell.
4648 * {color-idx} is a number from 0 to 255
4649 *
4650 * Screen cell with same width, attributes and color as the previous one:
4651 * |{characters}
4652 *
4653 * To use the color of the previous cell, use "&" instead of {color}-{idx}.
4654 *
4655 * Repeating the previous screen cell:
4656 * @{count}
4657 */
4658 void
4659f_term_dumpwrite(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
4660{
4661 buf_T *buf = term_get_buf(argvars, "term_dumpwrite()");
4662 term_T *term;
4663 char_u *fname;
4664 int max_height = 0;
4665 int max_width = 0;
4666 stat_T st;
4667 FILE *fd;
4668 VTermPos pos;
4669 VTermScreen *screen;
4670 VTermScreenCell prev_cell;
4671 VTermState *state;
4672 VTermPos cursor_pos;
4673
4674 if (check_restricted() || check_secure())
4675 return;
4676 if (buf == NULL((void*)0))
4677 return;
4678 term = buf->b_term;
4679 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
4680 {
4681 emsg(_("E958: Job already finished")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E958: Job already finished")
, 5));
4682 return;
4683 }
4684
4685 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN)
4686 {
4687 dict_T *d;
4688
4689 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_DICT)
4690 {
4691 emsg(_(e_dictreq)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_dictreq), 5));
4692 return;
4693 }
4694 d = argvars[2].vval.v_dict;
4695 if (d != NULL((void*)0))
4696 {
4697 max_height = dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"rows");
4698 max_width = dict_get_number(d, (char_u *)"columns");
4699 }
4700 }
4701
4702 fname = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[1]);
4703 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
4704 return;
4705 if (mch_stat((char *)fname, &st)stat(((char *)fname), (&st)) >= 0)
4706 {
4707 semsg(_("E953: File exists: %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E953: File exists: %s"), 5), fname);
4708 return;
4709 }
4710
4711 if (*fname == NUL'\000' || (fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, WRITEBIN)fopen(((char *)fname), ("w"))) == NULL((void*)0))
4712 {
4713 semsg(_(e_notcreate)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_notcreate), 5), *fname == NUL'\000' ? (char_u *)_("<empty>")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("<empty>"), 5) : fname);
4714 return;
4715 }
4716
4717 clear_cell(&prev_cell);
4718
4719 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(term->tl_vterm);
4720 state = vterm_obtain_state(term->tl_vterm);
4721 vterm_state_get_cursorpos(state, &cursor_pos);
4722
4723 for (pos.row = 0; (max_height == 0 || pos.row < max_height)
4724 && pos.row < term->tl_rows; ++pos.row)
4725 {
4726 int repeat = 0;
4727
4728 for (pos.col = 0; (max_width == 0 || pos.col < max_width)
4729 && pos.col < term->tl_cols; ++pos.col)
4730 {
4731 VTermScreenCell cell;
4732 int same_attr;
4733 int same_chars = TRUE1;
4734 int i;
4735 int is_cursor_pos = (pos.col == cursor_pos.col
4736 && pos.row == cursor_pos.row);
4737
4738 if (vterm_screen_get_cell(screen, pos, &cell) == 0)
4739 clear_cell(&cell);
4740
4741 for (i = 0; i < VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6; ++i)
4742 {
4743 int c = cell.chars[i];
4744 int pc = prev_cell.chars[i];
4745 int should_break = c == NUL'\000' || pc == NUL'\000';
4746
4747 // For the first character NUL is the same as space.
4748 if (i == 0)
4749 {
4750 c = (c == NUL'\000') ? ' ' : c;
4751 pc = (pc == NUL'\000') ? ' ' : pc;
4752 }
4753 if (c != pc)
4754 same_chars = FALSE0;
4755 if (should_break)
4756 break;
4757 }
4758 same_attr = vtermAttr2hl(cell.attrs)
4759 == vtermAttr2hl(prev_cell.attrs)
4760 && vterm_color_is_equal(&cell.fg, &prev_cell.fg)
4761 && vterm_color_is_equal(&cell.bg, &prev_cell.bg);
4762 if (same_chars && cell.width == prev_cell.width && same_attr
4763 && !is_cursor_pos)
4764 {
4765 ++repeat;
4766 }
4767 else
4768 {
4769 if (repeat > 0)
4770 {
4771 fprintf(fd, "@%d", repeat);
4772 repeat = 0;
4773 }
4774 fputs(is_cursor_pos ? ">" : "|", fd);
4775
4776 if (cell.chars[0] == NUL'\000')
4777 fputs(" ", fd);
4778 else
4779 {
4780 char_u charbuf[10];
4781 int len;
4782
4783 for (i = 0; i < VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6
4784 && cell.chars[i] != NUL'\000'; ++i)
4785 {
4786 len = utf_char2bytes(cell.chars[i], charbuf);
4787 fwrite(charbuf, len, 1, fd);
4788 }
4789 }
4790
4791 // When only the characters differ we don't write anything, the
4792 // following "|", "@" or NL will indicate using the same
4793 // attributes.
4794 if (cell.width != prev_cell.width || !same_attr)
4795 {
4796 if (cell.width == 2)
4797 fputs("*", fd);
4798 else
4799 fputs("+", fd);
4800
4801 if (same_attr)
4802 {
4803 fputs("&", fd);
4804 }
4805 else
4806 {
4807 fprintf(fd, "%d", vtermAttr2hl(cell.attrs));
4808 if (vterm_color_is_equal(&cell.fg, &prev_cell.fg))
4809 fputs("&", fd);
4810 else
4811 {
4812 fputs("#", fd);
4813 dump_term_color(fd, &cell.fg);
4814 }
4815 if (vterm_color_is_equal(&cell.bg, &prev_cell.bg))
4816 fputs("&", fd);
4817 else
4818 {
4819 fputs("#", fd);
4820 dump_term_color(fd, &cell.bg);
4821 }
4822 }
4823 }
4824
4825 prev_cell = cell;
4826 }
4827
4828 if (cell.width == 2)
4829 ++pos.col;
4830 }
4831 if (repeat > 0)
4832 fprintf(fd, "@%d", repeat);
4833 fputs("\n", fd);
4834 }
4835
4836 fclose(fd);
4837}

4865
4866/*
4867 * Read the dump file from "fd" and append lines to the current buffer.
4868 * Return the cell width of the longest line.
4869 */
4870 static int
4871read_dump_file(FILE *fd, VTermPos *cursor_pos)
4872{
4873 int c;
4874 garray_T ga_text;
4875 garray_T ga_cell;
4876 char_u *prev_char = NULL((void*)0);
4877 int attr = 0;
4878 cellattr_T cell;
4879 cellattr_T empty_cell;
4880 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
4881 int max_cells = 0;
4882 int start_row = term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
4883
4884 ga_init2(&ga_text, 1, 90);
4885 ga_init2(&ga_cell, sizeof(cellattr_T), 90);
4886 clear_cellattr(&cell);
4887 clear_cellattr(&empty_cell);
4888 cursor_pos->row = -1;
4889 cursor_pos->col = -1;
4890
4891 c = fgetc(fd);
4892 for (;;)
4893 {
4894 if (c == EOF(-1))
4895 break;
4896 if (c == '\r')
4897 {
4898 // DOS line endings? Ignore.
4899 c = fgetc(fd);
4900 }
4901 else if (c == '\n')
4902 {
4903 // End of a line: append it to the buffer.
4904 if (ga_text.ga_data == NULL((void*)0))
4905 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
4906 if (ga_grow(&term->tl_scrollback, 1) == OK1)
4907 {
4908 sb_line_T *line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data
4909 + term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
4910
4911 if (max_cells < ga_cell.ga_len)
4912 max_cells = ga_cell.ga_len;
4913 line->sb_cols = ga_cell.ga_len;
4914 line->sb_cells = ga_cell.ga_data;
4915 line->sb_fill_attr = term->tl_default_color;
4916 ++term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
4917 ga_init(&ga_cell);
4918
4919 ga_append(&ga_text, NUL'\000');
4920 ml_append(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, ga_text.ga_data,
4921 ga_text.ga_len, FALSE0);
4922 }
4923 else
4924 ga_clear(&ga_cell);
4925 ga_text.ga_len = 0;
4926
4927 c = fgetc(fd);
4928 }
4929 else if (c == '|' || c == '>')
4930 {
4931 int prev_len = ga_text.ga_len;
4932
4933 if (c == '>')
4934 {
4935 if (cursor_pos->row != -1)
4936 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text); // duplicate cursor
4937 cursor_pos->row = term->tl_scrollback.ga_len - start_row;
4938 cursor_pos->col = ga_cell.ga_len;
4939 }
4940
4941 // normal character(s) followed by "+", "*", "|", "@" or NL
4942 c = fgetc(fd);
4943 if (c != EOF(-1))
4944 ga_append(&ga_text, c);
4945 for (;;)
4946 {
4947 c = fgetc(fd);
4948 if (c == '+' || c == '*' || c == '|' || c == '>' || c == '@'
4949 || c == EOF(-1) || c == '\n')
4950 break;
4951 ga_append(&ga_text, c);
4952 }
4953
4954 // save the character for repeating it
4955 vim_free(prev_char);
4956 if (ga_text.ga_data != NULL((void*)0))
4957 prev_char = vim_strnsave(((char_u *)ga_text.ga_data) + prev_len,
4958 ga_text.ga_len - prev_len);
4959
4960 if (c == '@' || c == '|' || c == '>' || c == '\n')
4961 {
4962 // use all attributes from previous cell
4963 }
4964 else if (c == '+' || c == '*')
4965 {
4966 int is_bg;
4967
4968 cell.width = c == '+' ? 1 : 2;
4969
4970 c = fgetc(fd);
4971 if (c == '&')
4972 {
4973 // use same attr as previous cell
4974 c = fgetc(fd);
4975 }
4976 else if (isdigit(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISdigit
))
4977 {
4978 // get the decimal attribute
4979 attr = 0;
4980 while (isdigit(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISdigit
))
4981 {
4982 attr = attr * 10 + (c - '0');
4983 c = fgetc(fd);
4984 }
4985 hl2vtermAttr(attr, &cell);
4986
4987 // is_bg == 0: fg, is_bg == 1: bg
4988 for (is_bg = 0; is_bg <= 1; ++is_bg)
4989 {
4990 if (c == '&')
4991 {
4992 // use same color as previous cell
4993 c = fgetc(fd);
4994 }
4995 else if (c == '#')
4996 {
4997 int red, green, blue, index = 0, type;
4998
4999 c = fgetc(fd);
5000 red = hex2nr(c);
5001 c = fgetc(fd);
5002 red = (red << 4) + hex2nr(c);
5003 c = fgetc(fd);
5004 green = hex2nr(c);
5005 c = fgetc(fd);
5006 green = (green << 4) + hex2nr(c);
5007 c = fgetc(fd);
5008 blue = hex2nr(c);
5009 c = fgetc(fd);
5010 blue = (blue << 4) + hex2nr(c);
5011 c = fgetc(fd);
5012 if (!isdigit(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISdigit
))
5013 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5014 while (isdigit(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISdigit
))
5015 {
5016 index = index * 10 + (c - '0');
5017 c = fgetc(fd);
5018 }
5019 if (index == 0 || index == 255)
5020 {
5021 type = VTERM_COLOR_RGB;
5022 if (index == 0)
5023 {
5024 if (is_bg)
5025 type |= VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_BG;
5026 else
5027 type |= VTERM_COLOR_DEFAULT_FG;
5028 }
5029 }
5030 else
5031 {
5032 type = VTERM_COLOR_INDEXED;
5033 index -= 1;
5034 }
5035 if (is_bg)
5036 {
5037 cell.bg.type = type;
5038 cell.bg.red = red;
5039 cell.bg.green = green;
5040 cell.bg.blue = blue;
5041 cell.bg.index = index;
5042 }
5043 else
5044 {
5045 cell.fg.type = type;
5046 cell.fg.red = red;
5047 cell.fg.green = green;
5048 cell.fg.blue = blue;
5049 cell.fg.index = index;
5050 }
5051 }
5052 else
5053 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5054 }
5055 }
5056 else
5057 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5058 }
5059 else
5060 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5061
5062 append_cell(&ga_cell, &cell);
5063 if (cell.width == 2)
5064 append_cell(&ga_cell, &empty_cell);
5065 }
5066 else if (c == '@')
5067 {
5068 if (prev_char == NULL((void*)0))
5069 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5070 else
5071 {
5072 int count = 0;
5073
5074 // repeat previous character, get the count
5075 for (;;)
5076 {
5077 c = fgetc(fd);
5078 if (!isdigit(c)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((c))] & (unsigned short int) _ISdigit
))
5079 break;
5080 count = count * 10 + (c - '0');
5081 }
5082
5083 while (count-- > 0)
5084 {
5085 ga_concat(&ga_text, prev_char);
5086 append_cell(&ga_cell, &cell);
5087 }
5088 }
5089 }
5090 else
5091 {
5092 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5093 c = fgetc(fd);
5094 }
5095 }
5096
5097 if (ga_text.ga_len > 0)
5098 {
5099 // trailing characters after last NL
5100 dump_is_corrupt(&ga_text);
5101 ga_append(&ga_text, NUL'\000');
5102 ml_append(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, ga_text.ga_data,
5103 ga_text.ga_len, FALSE0);
5104 }
5105
5106 ga_clear(&ga_text);
5107 ga_clear(&ga_cell);
5108 vim_free(prev_char);
5109
5110 return max_cells;
5111}

5113/*
5114 * Return an allocated string with at least "text_width" "=" characters and
5115 * "fname" inserted in the middle.
5116 */
5117 static char_u *
5118get_separator(int text_width, char_u *fname)
5119{
5120 int width = MAX(text_width, curwin->w_width)(((text_width)>(curwin->w_width))?(text_width):(curwin->
w_width));
5121 char_u *textline;
5122 int fname_size;
5123 char_u *p = fname;
5124 int i;
5125 size_t off;
5126
5127 textline = alloc(width + (int)STRLEN(fname)strlen((char *)(fname)) + 1);
5128 if (textline == NULL((void*)0))
5129 return NULL((void*)0);
5130
5131 fname_size = vim_strsize(fname);
5132 if (fname_size < width - 8)
5133 {
5134 // enough room, don't use the full window width
5135 width = MAX(text_width, fname_size + 8)(((text_width)>(fname_size + 8))?(text_width):(fname_size +
8));
5136 }
5137 else if (fname_size > width - 8)
5138 {
5139 // full name doesn't fit, use only the tail
5140 p = gettail(fname);
5141 fname_size = vim_strsize(p);
5142 }
5143 // skip characters until the name fits
5144 while (fname_size > width - 8)
5145 {
5146 p += (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
5147 fname_size = vim_strsize(p);
5148 }
5149
5150 for (i = 0; i < (width - fname_size) / 2 - 1; ++i)
5151 textline[i] = '=';
5152 textline[i++] = ' ';
5153
5154 STRCPY(textline + i, p)strcpy((char *)(textline + i), (char *)(p));
5155 off = STRLEN(textline)strlen((char *)(textline));
5156 textline[off] = ' ';
5157 for (i = 1; i < (width - fname_size) / 2; ++i)
5158 textline[off + i] = '=';
5159 textline[off + i] = NUL'\000';
5160
5161 return textline;
5162}

5164/*
5165 * Common for "term_dumpdiff()" and "term_dumpload()".
5166 */
5167 static void
5168term_load_dump(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int do_diff)
5169{
5170 jobopt_T opt;
5171 buf_T *buf = NULL((void*)0);
5172 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN65];
5173 char_u buf2[NUMBUFLEN65];
5174 char_u *fname1;
5175 char_u *fname2 = NULL((void*)0);
5176 char_u *fname_tofree = NULL((void*)0);
5177 FILE *fd1;
5178 FILE *fd2 = NULL((void*)0);
5179 char_u *textline = NULL((void*)0);
5180
5181 // First open the files. If this fails bail out.
5182 fname1 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[0], buf1);
5183 if (do_diff)
5184 fname2 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], buf2);
5185 if (fname1 == NULL((void*)0) || (do_diff && fname2 == NULL((void*)0)))
5186 {
5187 emsg(_(e_invarg)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg), 5));
5188 return;
5189 }
5190 fd1 = mch_fopen((char *)fname1, READBIN)fopen(((char *)fname1), ("r"));
5191 if (fd1 == NULL((void*)0))
5192 {
5193 semsg(_(e_notread)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_notread), 5), fname1);
5194 return;
5195 }
5196 if (do_diff)
5197 {
5198 fd2 = mch_fopen((char *)fname2, READBIN)fopen(((char *)fname2), ("r"));
5199 if (fd2 == NULL((void*)0))
5200 {
5201 fclose(fd1);
5202 semsg(_(e_notread)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_notread), 5), fname2);
5203 return;
5204 }
5205 }
5206
5207 init_job_options(&opt);
5208 if (argvars[do_diff ? 2 : 1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN
5209 && get_job_options(&argvars[do_diff ? 2 : 1], &opt, 0,
5210 JO2_TERM_NAME0x0004 + JO2_TERM_COLS0x0080 + JO2_TERM_ROWS0x0040
5211 + JO2_VERTICAL0x0100 + JO2_CURWIN0x0200 + JO2_NORESTORE0x2000) == FAIL0)
5212 goto theend;
5213
5214 if (opt.jo_term_name == NULL((void*)0))
5215 {
5216 size_t len = STRLEN(fname1)strlen((char *)(fname1)) + 12;
5217
5218 fname_tofree = alloc(len);
5219 if (fname_tofree != NULL((void*)0))
5220 {
5221 vim_snprintf((char *)fname_tofree, len, "dump diff %s", fname1);
5222 opt.jo_term_name = fname_tofree;
5223 }
5224 }
5225
5226 if (opt.jo_bufnr_buf != NULL((void*)0))
5227 {
5228 win_T *wp = buf_jump_open_win(opt.jo_bufnr_buf);
5229
5230 // With "bufnr" argument: enter the window with this buffer and make it
5231 // empty.
5232 if (wp == NULL((void*)0))
5233 semsg(_(e_invarg2)dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(e_invarg2), 5), "bufnr");
5234 else
5235 {
5236 buf = curbuf;
5237 while (!(curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY1))
5238 ml_delete((linenr_T)1);
5239 free_scrollback(curbuf->b_term);
5240 redraw_later(NOT_VALID40);
5241 }
5242 }
5243 else
5244 // Create a new terminal window.
5245 buf = term_start(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0), &opt, TERM_START_NOJOB1);
5246
5247 if (buf != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_term != NULL((void*)0))
5248 {
5249 int i;
5250 linenr_T bot_lnum;
5251 linenr_T lnum;
5252 term_T *term = buf->b_term;
5253 int width;
5254 int width2;
5255 VTermPos cursor_pos1;
5256 VTermPos cursor_pos2;
5257
5258 init_default_colors(term, NULL((void*)0));
5259
5260 rettv->vval.v_number = buf->b_fnum;
5261
5262 // read the files, fill the buffer with the diff
5263 width = read_dump_file(fd1, &cursor_pos1);
5264
5265 // position the cursor
5266 if (cursor_pos1.row >= 0)
5267 {
5268 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = cursor_pos1.row + 1;
5269 coladvance(cursor_pos1.col);
5270 }
5271
5272 // Delete the empty line that was in the empty buffer.
5273 ml_delete(1);
5274
5275 // For term_dumpload() we are done here.
5276 if (!do_diff)
5277 goto theend;
5278
5279 term->tl_top_diff_rows = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5280
5281 textline = get_separator(width, fname1);
5282 if (textline == NULL((void*)0))
5283 goto theend;
5284 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &term->tl_default_color, 0) == OK1)
5285 ml_append(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, textline, 0, FALSE0);
5286 vim_free(textline);
5287
5288 textline = get_separator(width, fname2);
5289 if (textline == NULL((void*)0))
5290 goto theend;
5291 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &term->tl_default_color, 0) == OK1)
5292 ml_append(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count, textline, 0, FALSE0);
5293 textline[width] = NUL'\000';
5294
5295 bot_lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5296 width2 = read_dump_file(fd2, &cursor_pos2);
5297 if (width2 > width)
5298 {
5299 vim_free(textline);
5300 textline = alloc(width2 + 1);
5301 if (textline == NULL((void*)0))
5302 goto theend;
5303 width = width2;
5304 textline[width] = NUL'\000';
5305 }
5306 term->tl_bot_diff_rows = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count - bot_lnum;
5307
5308 for (lnum = 1; lnum <= term->tl_top_diff_rows; ++lnum)
5309 {
5310 if (lnum + bot_lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
5311 {
5312 // bottom part has fewer rows, fill with "-"
5313 for (i = 0; i < width; ++i)
5314 textline[i] = '-';
5315 }
5316 else
5317 {
5318 char_u *line1;
5319 char_u *line2;
5320 char_u *p1;
5321 char_u *p2;
5322 int col;
5323 sb_line_T *sb_line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data;
5324 cellattr_T *cellattr1 = (sb_line + lnum - 1)->sb_cells;
5325 cellattr_T *cellattr2 = (sb_line + lnum + bot_lnum - 1)
5326 ->sb_cells;
5327
5328 // Make a copy, getting the second line will invalidate it.
5329 line1 = vim_strsave(ml_get(lnum));
5330 if (line1 == NULL((void*)0))
5331 break;
5332 p1 = line1;
5333
5334 line2 = ml_get(lnum + bot_lnum);
5335 p2 = line2;
5336 for (col = 0; col < width && *p1 != NUL'\000' && *p2 != NUL'\000'; ++col)
5337 {
5338 int len1 = utfc_ptr2len(p1);
5339 int len2 = utfc_ptr2len(p2);
5340
5341 textline[col] = ' ';
5342 if (len1 != len2 || STRNCMP(p1, p2, len1)strncmp((char *)(p1), (char *)(p2), (size_t)(len1)) != 0)
5343 // text differs
5344 textline[col] = 'X';
5345 else if (lnum == cursor_pos1.row + 1
5346 && col == cursor_pos1.col
5347 && (cursor_pos1.row != cursor_pos2.row
5348 || cursor_pos1.col != cursor_pos2.col))
5349 // cursor in first but not in second
5350 textline[col] = '>';
5351 else if (lnum == cursor_pos2.row + 1
5352 && col == cursor_pos2.col
5353 && (cursor_pos1.row != cursor_pos2.row
5354 || cursor_pos1.col != cursor_pos2.col))
5355 // cursor in second but not in first
5356 textline[col] = '<';
5357 else if (cellattr1 != NULL((void*)0) && cellattr2 != NULL((void*)0))
5358 {
5359 if ((cellattr1 + col)->width
5360 != (cellattr2 + col)->width)
5361 textline[col] = 'w';
5362 else if (!vterm_color_is_equal(&(cellattr1 + col)->fg,
5363 &(cellattr2 + col)->fg))
5364 textline[col] = 'f';
5365 else if (!vterm_color_is_equal(&(cellattr1 + col)->bg,
5366 &(cellattr2 + col)->bg))
5367 textline[col] = 'b';
5368 else if (vtermAttr2hl((cellattr1 + col)->attrs)
5369 != vtermAttr2hl(((cellattr2 + col)->attrs)))
5370 textline[col] = 'a';
5371 }
5372 p1 += len1;
5373 p2 += len2;
5374 // TODO: handle different width
5375 }
5376
5377 while (col < width)
5378 {
5379 if (*p1 == NUL'\000' && *p2 == NUL'\000')
5380 textline[col] = '?';
5381 else if (*p1 == NUL'\000')
5382 {
5383 textline[col] = '+';
5384 p2 += utfc_ptr2len(p2);
5385 }
5386 else
5387 {
5388 textline[col] = '-';
5389 p1 += utfc_ptr2len(p1);
5390 }
5391 ++col;
5392 }
5393
5394 vim_free(line1);
5395 }
5396 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &term->tl_default_color,
5397 term->tl_top_diff_rows) == OK1)
5398 ml_append(term->tl_top_diff_rows + lnum, textline, 0, FALSE0);
5399 ++bot_lnum;
5400 }
5401
5402 while (lnum + bot_lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
5403 {
5404 // bottom part has more rows, fill with "+"
5405 for (i = 0; i < width; ++i)
5406 textline[i] = '+';
5407 if (add_empty_scrollback(term, &term->tl_default_color,
5408 term->tl_top_diff_rows) == OK1)
5409 ml_append(term->tl_top_diff_rows + lnum, textline, 0, FALSE0);
5410 ++lnum;
5411 ++bot_lnum;
5412 }
5413
5414 term->tl_cols = width;
5415
5416 // looks better without wrapping
5417 curwin->w_p_wrapw_onebuf_opt.wo_wrap = 0;
5418 }
5419
5420theend:
5421 vim_free(textline);
5422 vim_free(fname_tofree);
5423 fclose(fd1);
5424 if (fd2 != NULL((void*)0))
5425 fclose(fd2);
5426}
5427
5428/*
5429 * If the current buffer shows the output of term_dumpdiff(), swap the top and
5430 * bottom files.
5431 * Return FAIL when this is not possible.
5432 */
5433 int
5434term_swap_diff()
5435{
5436 term_T *term = curbuf->b_term;
5437 linenr_T line_count;
5438 linenr_T top_rows;
5439 linenr_T bot_rows;
5440 linenr_T bot_start;
5441 linenr_T lnum;
5442 char_u *p;
5443 sb_line_T *sb_line;
5444
5445 if (term == NULL((void*)0)
5446 || !term_is_finished(curbuf)
5447 || term->tl_top_diff_rows == 0
5448 || term->tl_scrollback.ga_len == 0)
5449 return FAIL0;
5450
5451 line_count = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
5452 top_rows = term->tl_top_diff_rows;
5453 bot_rows = term->tl_bot_diff_rows;
5454 bot_start = line_count - bot_rows;
5455 sb_line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data;
5456
5457 // move lines from top to above the bottom part
5458 for (lnum = 1; lnum <= top_rows; ++lnum)
5459 {
5460 p = vim_strsave(ml_get(1));
5461 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5462 return OK1;
5463 ml_append(bot_start, p, 0, FALSE0);
5464 ml_delete(1);
5465 vim_free(p);
5466 }
5467
5468 // move lines from bottom to the top
5469 for (lnum = 1; lnum <= bot_rows; ++lnum)
5470 {
5471 p = vim_strsave(ml_get(bot_start + lnum));
5472 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5473 return OK1;
5474 ml_delete(bot_start + lnum);
5475 ml_append(lnum - 1, p, 0, FALSE0);
5476 vim_free(p);
5477 }
5478
5479 // move top title to bottom
5480 p = vim_strsave(ml_get(bot_rows + 1));
5481 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5482 return OK1;
5483 ml_append(line_count - top_rows - 1, p, 0, FALSE0);
5484 ml_delete(bot_rows + 1);
5485 vim_free(p);
5486
5487 // move bottom title to top
5488 p = vim_strsave(ml_get(line_count - top_rows));
5489 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5490 return OK1;
5491 ml_delete(line_count - top_rows);
5492 ml_append(bot_rows, p, 0, FALSE0);
5493 vim_free(p);
5494
5495 if (top_rows == bot_rows)
5496 {
5497 // rows counts are equal, can swap cell properties
5498 for (lnum = 0; lnum < top_rows; ++lnum)
5499 {
5500 sb_line_T temp;
5501
5502 temp = *(sb_line + lnum);
5503 *(sb_line + lnum) = *(sb_line + bot_start + lnum);
5504 *(sb_line + bot_start + lnum) = temp;
5505 }
5506 }
5507 else
5508 {
5509 size_t size = sizeof(sb_line_T) * term->tl_scrollback.ga_len;
5510 sb_line_T *temp = alloc(size);
5511
5512 // need to copy cell properties into temp memory
5513 if (temp != NULL((void*)0))
5514 {
5515 mch_memmove(temp, term->tl_scrollback.ga_data, size)memmove((char *)(temp), (char *)(term->tl_scrollback.ga_data
), size);
5516 mch_memmove(term->tl_scrollback.ga_data,memmove((char *)(term->tl_scrollback.ga_data), (char *)(temp
+ bot_start), sizeof(sb_line_T) * bot_rows)
5517 temp + bot_start,memmove((char *)(term->tl_scrollback.ga_data), (char *)(temp
+ bot_start), sizeof(sb_line_T) * bot_rows)

5573{

5575 size_t i;
5576 char_u *name;
5577
5578 static struct {
5579 char *name;
5580 int attr;
5581 } attrs[] = {
5582 {"bold", HL_BOLD0x02},
5583 {"italic", HL_ITALIC0x04},
5584 {"underline", HL_UNDERLINE0x08},
5585 {"strike", HL_STRIKETHROUGH0x80},
5586 {"reverse", HL_INVERSE0x01},
5587 };
5588
5589 attr = tv_get_number(&argvars[0]);
5590 name = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[1]);
5591 if (name == NULL((void*)0))
5592 return;

5594 if (attr > HL_ALL0xff)
5595 attr = syn_attr2attr(attr);
5596 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(attrs)/sizeof(attrs[0]); ++i)
5597 if (STRCMP(name, attrs[i].name)strcmp((char *)(name), (char *)(attrs[i].name)) == 0)
5598 {
5599 rettv->vval.v_number = (attr & attrs[i].attr) != 0 ? 1 : 0;
5600 break;
5601 }
5602}

5670 */
5671 void
5672f_term_getline(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
5673{
5674 buf_T *buf = term_get_buf(argvars, "term_getline()");
5675 term_T *term;
5676 int row;
5677
5678 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
5679 if (buf == NULL((void*)0))
5680 return;
5681 term = buf->b_term;
5682 row = get_row_number(&argvars[1], term);
5683
5684 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
5685 {
5686 linenr_T lnum = row + term->tl_scrollback_scrolled + 1;
5687
5688 // vterm is finished, get the text from the buffer
5689 if (lnum > 0 && lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
5690 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, FALSE0));
5691 }
5692 else
5693 {
5694 VTermScreen *screen = vterm_obtain_screen(term->tl_vterm);
5695 VTermRect rect;
5696 int len;
5697 char_u *p;
5698
5699 if (row < 0 || row >= term->tl_rows)
5700 return;
5701 len = term->tl_cols * MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1;
5702 p = alloc(len);
5703 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
5704 return;
5705 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
5706
5707 rect.start_col = 0;
5708 rect.end_col = term->tl_cols;
5709 rect.start_row = row;
5710 rect.end_row = row + 1;
5711 p[vterm_screen_get_text(screen, (char *)p, len, rect)] = NUL'\000';
5712 }
5713}

5871/*
5872 * "term_scrape(buf, row)" function
5873 */
5874 void
5875f_term_scrape(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
5876{
5877 buf_T *buf = term_get_buf(argvars, "term_scrape()");
5878 VTermScreen *screen = NULL((void*)0);
5879 VTermPos pos;
5880 list_T *l;
5881 term_T *term;
5882 char_u *p;
5883 sb_line_T *line;
5884
5885 if (rettv_list_alloc(rettv) == FAIL0)
5886 return;
5887 if (buf == NULL((void*)0))
5888 return;
5889 term = buf->b_term;
5890
5891 l = rettv->vval.v_list;
5892 pos.row = get_row_number(&argvars[1], term);
5893
5894 if (term->tl_vterm != NULL((void*)0))
5895 {
5896 screen = vterm_obtain_screen(term->tl_vterm);
5897 if (screen == NULL((void*)0)) // can't really happen
5898 return;
5899 p = NULL((void*)0);
5900 line = NULL((void*)0);
5901 }
5902 else
5903 {
5904 linenr_T lnum = pos.row + term->tl_scrollback_scrolled;
5905
5906 if (lnum < 0 || lnum >= term->tl_scrollback.ga_len)
5907 return;
5908 p = ml_get_buf(buf, lnum + 1, FALSE0);
5909 line = (sb_line_T *)term->tl_scrollback.ga_data + lnum;
5910 }
5911
5912 for (pos.col = 0; pos.col < term->tl_cols; )
5913 {
5914 dict_T *dcell;
5915 int width;
5916 VTermScreenCellAttrs attrs;
5917 VTermColor fg, bg;
5918 char_u rgb[8];
5919 char_u mbs[MB_MAXBYTES21 * VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6 + 1];
5920 int off = 0;
5921 int i;
5922
5923 if (screen == NULL((void*)0))
5924 {
5925 cellattr_T *cellattr;
5926 int len;
5927
5928 // vterm has finished, get the cell from scrollback
5929 if (pos.col >= line->sb_cols)
5930 break;
5931 cellattr = line->sb_cells + pos.col;
5932 width = cellattr->width;
5933 attrs = cellattr->attrs;
5934 fg = cellattr->fg;
5935 bg = cellattr->bg;
5936 len = mb_ptr2len(p);
5937 mch_memmove(mbs, p, len)memmove((char *)(mbs), (char *)(p), len);
5938 mbs[len] = NUL'\000';
5939 p += len;
5940 }
5941 else
5942 {
5943 VTermScreenCell cell;
5944
5945 if (vterm_screen_get_cell(screen, pos, &cell) == 0)
5946 break;
5947 for (i = 0; i < VTERM_MAX_CHARS_PER_CELL6; ++i)
5948 {
5949 if (cell.chars[i] == 0)
5950 break;
5951 off += (*utf_char2bytes)((int)cell.chars[i], mbs + off);
5952 }
5953 mbs[off] = NUL'\000';
5954 width = cell.width;
5955 attrs = cell.attrs;
5956 fg = cell.fg;
5957 bg = cell.bg;
5958 }
5959 dcell = dict_alloc();
5960 if (dcell == NULL((void*)0))
5961 break;
5962 list_append_dict(l, dcell);
5963
5964 dict_add_string(dcell, "chars", mbs);
5965
5966 vim_snprintf((char *)rgb, 8, "#%02x%02x%02x",
5967 fg.red, fg.green, fg.blue);
5968 dict_add_string(dcell, "fg", rgb);
5969 vim_snprintf((char *)rgb, 8, "#%02x%02x%02x",
5970 bg.red, bg.green, bg.blue);
5971 dict_add_string(dcell, "bg", rgb);
5972
5973 dict_add_number(dcell, "attr", cell2attr(term, NULL((void*)0), attrs, fg, bg));
5974 dict_add_number(dcell, "width", width);
5975
5976 ++pos.col;
5977 if (width == 2)
5978 ++pos.col;
5979 }
5980}

5982/*
5983 * "term_sendkeys(buf, keys)" function
5984 */
5985 void
5986f_term_sendkeys(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
5987{
5988 buf_T *buf = term_get_buf(argvars, "term_sendkeys()");
5989 char_u *msg;
5990 term_T *term;
5991
5992 if (buf == NULL((void*)0))
5993 return;
5994
5995 msg = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[1]);
5996 if (msg == NULL((void*)0))
5997 return;
5998 term = buf->b_term;
5999 if (term->tl_vterm == NULL((void*)0))
6000 return;
6001
6002 while (*msg != NUL'\000')
6003 {
6004 int c;
6005
6006 if (*msg == K_SPECIAL(0x80) && msg[1] != NUL'\000' && msg[2] != NUL'\000')
6007 {
6008 c = TO_SPECIAL(msg[1], msg[2])((msg[1]) == 254 ? (0x80) : (msg[1]) == 255 ? (-((255) + ((int
)(('X')) << 8))) : (-((msg[1]) + ((int)(msg[2]) <<
8))));
6009 msg += 3;
6010 }
6011 else
6012 {
6013 c = PTR2CHAR(msg)(has_mbyte ? mb_ptr2char(msg) : (int)*(msg));
6014 msg += MB_CPTR2LEN(msg)(enc_utf8 ? utf_ptr2len(msg) : (*mb_ptr2len)(msg));
6015 }
6016 send_keys_to_term(term, c, 0, FALSE0);
6017 }
6018}

6119 if (cmd != NULL((void*)0))
6120 term->tl_command = vim_strsave(cmd);
6121 else
6122 term->tl_command = NULL((void*)0);
6123#endif
6124}

6147/*
6148 * "term_start(command, options)" function
6149 */
6150 void
6151f_term_start(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
6152{
6153 jobopt_T opt;
6154 buf_T *buf;
6155
6156 init_job_options(&opt);
6157 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN
6158 && get_job_options(&argvars[1], &opt,
6159 JO_TIMEOUT_ALL(0x0200 + 0x0400 + 0x0800) + JO_STOPONEXIT0x4000
6160 + JO_CALLBACK0x0010 + JO_OUT_CALLBACK0x0020 + JO_ERR_CALLBACK0x0040
6161 + JO_EXIT_CB0x8000 + JO_CLOSE_CALLBACK0x0080 + JO_OUT_IO0x10000,
6162 JO2_TERM_NAME0x0004 + JO2_TERM_FINISH0x0008 + JO2_HIDDEN0x0400 + JO2_TERM_OPENCMD0x0800
6163 + JO2_TERM_COLS0x0080 + JO2_TERM_ROWS0x0040 + JO2_VERTICAL0x0100 + JO2_CURWIN0x0200
6164 + JO2_CWD0x0020 + JO2_ENV0x0010 + JO2_EOF_CHARS0x1000
6165 + JO2_NORESTORE0x2000 + JO2_TERM_KILL0x4000 + JO2_TERM_HIGHLIGHT0x80000
6166 + JO2_ANSI_COLORS0x8000 + JO2_TTY_TYPE0x10000 + JO2_TERM_API0x40000) == FAIL0)
6167 return;
6168
6169 buf = term_start(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0), &opt, 0);
6170
6171 if (buf != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_term != NULL((void*)0))
6172 rettv->vval.v_number = buf->b_fnum;
6173}
6174
6175/*
6176 * "term_wait" function
6177 */
6178 void
6179f_term_wait(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv UNUSED__attribute__((unused)))
6180{
6181 buf_T *buf = term_get_buf(argvars, "term_wait()");
6182
6183 if (buf == NULL((void*)0))
6184 return;
6185 if (buf->b_term->tl_job == NULL((void*)0))
6186 {
6187 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "term_wait(): no job to wait for");
6188 return;
6189 }
6190 if (buf->b_term->tl_job->jv_channel == NULL((void*)0))
6191 // channel is closed, nothing to do
6192 return;
6193
6194 // Get the job status, this will detect a job that finished.
6195 if (!buf->b_term->tl_job->jv_channel->ch_keep_open
6196 && STRCMP(job_status(buf->b_term->tl_job), "dead")strcmp((char *)(job_status(buf->b_term->tl_job)), (char
*)("dead")) == 0)
6197 {
6198 // The job is dead, keep reading channel I/O until the channel is
6199 // closed. buf->b_term may become NULL if the terminal was closed while
6200 // waiting.
6201 ch_log(NULL((void*)0), "term_wait(): waiting for channel to close");
6202 while (buf->b_term != NULL((void*)0) && !buf->b_term->tl_channel_closed)
6203 {
6204 term_flush_messages();
6205
6206 ui_delay(10L, FALSE0);
6207 if (!buf_valid(buf))
6208 // If the terminal is closed when the channel is closed the
6209 // buffer disappears.
6210 break;
6211 }
6212
6213 term_flush_messages();
6214 }
6215 else
6216 {
6217 long wait = 10L;
6218
6219 term_flush_messages();
6220
6221 // Wait for some time for any channel I/O.
6222 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN)
6223 wait = tv_get_number(&argvars[1]);
6224 ui_delay(wait, TRUE1);
6225
6226 // Flushing messages on channels is hopefully sufficient.
6227 // TODO: is there a better way?
6228 term_flush_messages();
6229 }
6230}
6231
6232/*
6233 * Called when a channel has sent all the lines to a terminal.
6234 * Send a CTRL-D to mark the end of the text.
6235 */
6236 void
6237term_send_eof(channel_T *ch)
6238{
6239 term_T *term;
6240
6241 FOR_ALL_TERMS(term)for ((term) = first_term; (term) != ((void*)0); (term) = (term
)->tl_next)
6242 if (term->tl_job == ch->ch_job)
6243 {
6244 if (term->tl_eof_chars != NULL((void*)0))
6245 {
6246 channel_send(ch, PART_IN, term->tl_eof_chars,
6247 (int)STRLEN(term->tl_eof_chars)strlen((char *)(term->tl_eof_chars)), NULL((void*)0));
6248 channel_send(ch, PART_IN, (char_u *)"\r", 1, NULL((void*)0));
6249 }
6250# ifdef MSWIN
6251 else
6252 // Default: CTRL-D
6253 channel_send(ch, PART_IN, (char_u *)"\004\r", 2, NULL((void*)0));
6254# endif
6255 }
6256}
